Centennial Square Carolyn Gebbie invited you About Discussion More About Discussion Free EVENT - West Coast Swing in the Square - Thurs Sept 5! Details 123 people responded Event by BC Swing Dance Club Victoria Centennial Square Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Come join BC Swing Victoria for our second fabulous (and FREE) evening of fun and West Coast Swing dancing at Centennial Square! The schedule for the night will be: 6pm (sharp) there will be an intro lesson to West Coast Swing. 7 - 9pm WCS music will be provided by DJ Carolyn Gebbie. Note: For those who are familiar with the 2019 WCS Rally routine, and would like to practice performing it live prior to Sept 7, the "Hands Up” song will be played at 7:30 and 8:30pm. There will be WCS instructors on hand to answer questions about WCS or how to improve your WCS dancing. Please invite your dance friends by sharing this event! See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Saturday 15 March 2025 from 20:00-00:00 Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Method Studio - Victoria BC Becky Mowat invited you About Discussion More About Discussion Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Details 48 people responded Event by Becky Mowat and David Lamine Victoria Method Studio - Victoria BC Duration: 4 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Join us in welcoming Mannie for his first time to Victoria! Mannie was born in Zimbabwe and has lived in Manchester, London, San Francisco, NYC and currently in Dallas, Texas. He has a passion for music, dance and performance. He has won both dance and music contests, which is a testament to his technical skill, musicality, and performance artistry. His classes emphasize in precision, fluidity, and personal expression, ensuring that students not only master choreography but also understand the artistry behind it. Whether teaching beginners or advanced dancers, Mannie’s goals are to inspire confidence, discipline, and joy through movement, helping each student discover their unique dance voice. Details We will create two events as they are at separate locations on two different dates. The first one will be held at the Ukrainian Cultural Centre and the second at Medicine Moves Studio. There will be 4 hours of workshops in total. Mannie will be focusing on musicality, expression, connection and communication with your partner. Monday Nights! 111 Superior St, Victoria, BC V8V 1T2, Canada Mon, 7 Apr Mon, 14 Apr Mon, 21 Apr Mon, 28 Apr About Discussion More About Discussion Sensual Bachata Series – Monday Nights! Interested Going Invite Details 6 people responded Event by Victoria Latin Dance Association 111 Superior St, Victoria, BC V8V 1T2, Canada Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Sensual Bachata Series – Monday Nights! Mondays – April 7th, 14th, 21st & 28th at 111 Superior Street Foundation Class (6:30–7:35 PM) Perfect for absolute beginners or dancers looking to strengthen their foundation! In this class, we’ll break down the essential steps, body movement, and partner connection in a fun environment. You’ll learn the basics with proper technique while also adding styling to make your dancing look and feel smooth on the dance floor. No experience or partner needed—just bring your curiosity and energy! Intermediate Class (7:35–8:40 PM) Ready to level up? This class is designed for dancers who already feel comfortable with the basics and want to challenge themselves. We’ll dive into more fun patterns while also exploring musicality—how to connect those movements to the music in a more expressive way. Get ready to build confidence, fluidity, and your own unique style! To Register: Send your e-transfer to maximumotion@gmail.com and include in the memo: Foundation, Intermediate, or Both + Lead or Follow Class Cancellation & Refunds We understand that plans can change. However, due to limited spots, renting space in advance, and the preparation required for each class, we’re unable to offer refunds for cancellations. Please make sure you’re committed before signing up. We truly appreciate your understanding and support! (20+) Tango week with Lya  | Facebook Number of unread notifications 20+ Events Home Your events Notifications Create New Event Your upcoming events See all 17 Apr at 21:00 – 21 Apr at 07:00 Victoria International Kizomba Festival 6th: SENSUAL EDITION Mary and 17 friends 13 Jun at 20:00 – 15 Jun at 02:00 Becky's Birthday Bash & Fundraiser Mary and 7 friends Recommended events See all Today from 19:00-21:00 Flamenco Guitar Evening - April 17, 2025 Tomorrow from 12:00-13:00 Lunchtime Concerts Categories Classics Comedy Crafts Dance Drinks Fitness & workouts Foods Games Gardening Health & medical Healthy living and self-care Home and garden Music and audio Parties Professional networking Religions Shopping Social issues Sports Theatre TV and films Visual arts 16 16 Apr at 18:30 – 18 Apr at 21:00 Tango week with Lya Alive Tango Victoria About Discussion More About Discussion Tango week with Lya Interested Going Invite Details 36 people responded Event by Grazyna Sommerfeld and Alive Tango Victoria Alive Tango Victoria Duration: 3 days Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Ignite Your Tango 16th of April, Wednesday 6:30-8:00 On & Off Acis for social dance 18th of April, Friday 6:00 - 7:30 Follower technique 7:45 - 9:00 Switch role / connection Search - Grow & Transform! Seminar series for Tango Dancers that want to transform their way of moving and connecting! We will travel through the Essentials of Tango in order to look for new answers and deeper understanding. What makes tango truly captivating? It’s the embrace, the connection, and the walk. These three fundamental elements are the heartbeat of tango, and mastering them is essential for creating an unforgettable dance experience. You will learn how to condition your body to move with control, fluidity, and elegance. You’ll discover how to find and perfect your axis, which is essential for maintaining balance and stability in every step. We will also explore dissociation, a technique that allows you to move the upper and lower body independently but associated. This workshop series will show you how to apply these principles in both the leader and follower roles, improving connection and response in every moment of the dance. We will apply all this to: The secrets to generating power for boleos effortlessly off and on axis special follower technique class Pro tips to dance with ease and confidence 90 min class - $30 All 3 classes - $80 To register email grazs@shaw.ca or pm me, or talk to me . Ali and 4 friends Categories Classics Comedy Crafts Dance Drinks Fitness & workouts Foods Games Gardening Health & medical Healthy living and self-care Home and garden Music and audio Parties Professional networking Religions Shopping Social issues Sports Theatre TV and films Visual arts 4 Tuesday 4 February 2025 at 19:00 Changemaker Speaker Series: Althia Raj and David Coletto Victoria Conference Centre About Discussion More About Discussion Changemaker Speaker Series: Althia Raj and David Coletto Details Event by Royal Roads University Victoria Conference Centre Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Get an expert look at public opinion and political journalism and find out how both are changing in an age of polarization and misinformation, followed by a panel session moderated by Dr. Philip Steenkamp, President of Royal Roads. Bring your curiosity and your questions and enjoy this lively discussion. David Coletto Infinitely curious, passionate, and eternally optimistic — three words to describe David Coletto, the founder, chair, and CEO of Abacus Data. He is one of Canada’s best known and most respected public opinion analysts, pollsters, and social researchers and was recently named one of the Top 100 Most Influential People in Canadian politics by The Hill Times. With a career spanning over two decades, Coletto is the official pollster of the Toronto Star and considered a leading expert on generational change. In his timely, data-driven keynote presentations, he delivers strategic advice customized to his audiences and the industries they serve. Althia Raj Althia Raj is a multiple award-winning journalist, ranked as one of the top 100 most influential people in Canadian politics by The Hill Times since 2015. She is currently a national columnist with the Toronto Star; the host/producer of the podcast, It’s Political; and a regular weekly panelist on CBC’s At Issue panel. Having worked at the heart of Canadian politics for more than a decade, Raj shares a behind-the-scenes look at the inner workings of Ottawa, the state of politics, and what it means for her audience. Thursday 29 May 2025 at 18:00 Pendragon MtG 1v1 Event 103-1633 Hillside Ave, Victoria, BC, Canada, British Columbia V8T 2C4 About Discussion More About Discussion Pendragon MtG 1v1 Event Interested Going Invite Details 6 people responded Event by Gauntlet Games 103-1633 Hillside Ave, Victoria, BC, Canada, British Columbia V8T 2C4 Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Of Commons & Kings Welcome to Pendragon MTG. You will choose a champion of the common folk and equip them with a powerful weapon of legend. Together they will lead your armies into battle to win victory and glory for the realm. Discover your next favorite format. This will be a 3 Round (Best of 1) 1v1 Commander Variant Tournament, prizing out for players with positive records. Random Draws for Random Prizes, all participants receive a random Promo/Rare/Mythic. One player will win a "Most Fun to Play With" Prize voted by majority. As this format is pretty new we thought it would be fun to give it a swing as a 1v1 before we try a 4v4 tournament. Build something fun, don't come to crush. How it Works Pendragon is ultimately a Commander/EDH variant and therefore follows most of the same rules and regulations. Below is the basic setup and ways in which the format deviates from its predecessors. If a deviation is not explicitly stated, the default rules of Commander/EDH should be followed. Deck Size: 100 Card Singleton (4v4 or 1v1) Commanders: 1 Common Creature 1 Legendary Equipment *See MDFC & Reconfigure Equipment notes below Color Identity: Color identity is a combination of the color identity of the creature commander and the equipment. Cards in the 98: All cards not designated as commanders must be of common rarity or have a printing at common rarity (to include all cards downshifted to common on MTGO). (Format Deck Legal Cards) Life Total/Commander Damage: Life total is set at 30 Commander Damage is set at 21 points of combat damage from a single commander (this includes an equipment in the case in which an equipment commander is animated/becomes a creature) *MDFC Note: MDFC equipment is allowed in the Command Zone, but only the equipment side may be cast from the any zone. In the event that an MDFC equipment card is sent to any zone other than the Command Zone, it is treated as single sided equipment artifact and the non-equipment side of the card cannot be cast, summoned, or interacted with in any way; as if it did not exist. *Reconfigure Equipment Creatures Note: Currently only one Legendary Artifact Creature - Equipment exists, The Reality Chip. This is considered a legal Excalibur and can also inflict its own commander damage. If additional Legendary Artifact Creature - Equipment spells are released in the future they will also follow this ruling unless otherwise stated. Helpful links : https://sites.google.com/.../pendr.../basic-rules-guidelines https://moxfield.com/users/PendragonRRT See less Victoria, British Columbia 103-1633 Hillside Ave, Victoria, BC, Canada, British Columbia V8T 2C4 1633 Hillside Ave, Victoria, BC V8T 2C4, Canada Guests See All

Centennial Square Carolyn Gebbie invited you About Discussion More About Discussion Free EVENT - West Coast Swing in the Square - August 29! Details 109 people responded Event by BC Swing Dance Club Victoria Centennial Square Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Come join BC Swing Victoria for a fabulous (and FREE) evening of fun and West Coast Swing dancing at Centennial Square! The schedule for the night will be: 6pm (sharp) there will be an intro lesson to West Coast Swing. 7 - 9pm WCS music will be provided by DJ Carolyn Gebbie. Note: For those who are familiar with the 2019 WCS Rally routine, and would like to practice performing it live prior to Sept 7, the "Hands Up” song will be played at 7:30 and 8:30pm. See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Sunday 11 May 2025 at 19:00 String Theory ay Hermann’s Jazz Club Hermann's Jazz Club About Discussion More About Discussion String Theory ay Hermann’s Jazz Club Interested Going Invite Details 21 people responded Event by Big Awesome Entertainment and Eric Harper Hermann's Jazz Club Tickets hermannsjazz.com/show/734351/view Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Victoria BC!! Sunday May 11, come celebrate Mother’s Day with an evening of beautiful music! Two of Canadas foremost guitarists join together for an unparalleled evening of spectacular music. Having achieved impeccable musicianship and craft during his European conservatory training, Eric Harper took on the new challenge of studying film scoring at Berklee School of Music. By the time of his graduation, Eric had found his full stride as composer-singer-songwriter, with a style that evokes a mad but moving medley of The Dave Matthews Band, the Gipsy Kings and music a la Cirque du Soleil. Eric’s live show melds a bravura virtuosity with hilarity and heart-felt storytelling from his times living, learning, and loving deeply in multiple countries and cultures. As anyone who has seen an Eric Harper show can attest, there will be a lot of laughs and tears and dancing. Award winning Latin guitarist Doug Towle combines Salsa, Jazz, Flamenco and Pop to create a truly unique musical experience. Doug Towle is one of Canada’s premier guitarists. He has performed across North America in such prestigious events as Guitar Player Live in San Francisco, the Vancouver International Jazz Festival, The Zihuatenejo Guitar Festival in Mexico, several appearances at the Juan De Fuca Festival and the Harmony Arts Festival among countless other festival and club stages. In 2009 Guitar Player Magazine selected Doug from among thousands of hopefuls as a top ten finalist in their Guitar Superstar Competition, solidifying his reputation as one of the top players not only in Canada but globally. Monday 23 June 2025 at 19:00 TD JazzFest 2025: Anthony D'Alessandro Quartet f. Benny Benack III Hermann's Jazz Club About Discussion More About Discussion TD JazzFest 2025: Anthony D'Alessandro Quartet f. Benny Benack III Interested Going Invite Details 7 people responded Event by Victoria Jazz Society Hermann's Jazz Club Tickets jazzvictoria.ca/anthony-dalessandro-quartet-f-benny-benack-iii Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Tickets on sale April 11! “Anthony has a natural feeling for swing and groove, scintillating technique and a penchant for such feel-good pianists as Erroll Garner, Oscar Peterson, and Monty Alexander.” – WholeNote Magazine Toronto’s Anthony D’Alessandro is a pianist, composer, arranger, and bandleader. He has performed around the world, at the Montreal International Jazz Festival, the Teatro Nescafé de las Artes in Santiago, Chile, Smalls Jazz Club in New York, and Koerner Hall. He regularly collaborates with Canada’s top jazz musicians, including Caity Gyorgy, Neil Swainson, Terry Clarke, Pat LaBarbara, and Ernesto Cervini, as well as notable NYC musicians Summer Camargo, Alexander Claffy, and Joe Farnsworth. D’Alessandro’s debut full-length album Searchin’ (2024), featuring trumpeter/vocal star Benny Benack III, debuted to critical acclaim, described as “uplifting and feel-good jazz record” by the Paris Move. Benny Benack III trumpet/vocals, Jonathan Chapman bass, Ernesto Cervini drums Thanks to Canada Council for the Arts TICKETS On sale Friday, April 11! $38 (service charges may apply) Available Through: Victoria Jazz Society Office (250-388-4423 | 975A Alston St.) no service charges Royal & McPherson Box Office (250-386-6121 | rmts.bc.ca ) plus service charges See less Music and audio Victoria, British Columbia Tickets Find Tickets Hermann's Jazz Club 751 View St, Victoria, BC V8W 1J9, Canada Guests See All

See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Saturday 7 June 2025 from 19:00-00:00 The West Coast Cuban Orchestra Presents “A Tribute to the Queen of Salsa Celia Cruz” The Mint Victoria About Discussion More About Discussion The West Coast Cuban Orchestra Presents “A Tribute to the Queen of Salsa Celia Cruz” Interested Going Invite Details 32 people responded Event by Pablo Cardenas & The West Coast Cuban Orchestra , The Mint Victoria and 2 others The Mint Victoria Tickets community.admitone.com/events/67ef02643e68787395fc89a3 Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Pablo Cárdenas and The West Coast Cuban Orchestra Present a special night with the best of “The Queen of Salsa” Celia Cruz Doors 7pm, Salsa lesson from 7:15, show time 8pm, DJ Jorge Escobar will keep you going between sets, and after band until 12am. Cuban singer Celia Cruz was one of the most popular Latin artists of the 20th century. She rose to fame in Cuba during the 1950s as a singer of guarachas, earning the nickname "La Guarachera de Cuba". In the following decades, she became known internationally as the "Queen of Salsa" due to her contributions to Latin music. She had sold over 10 million records, making her one of the best-selling Latin music artists of all time. The amazing Tatianna Hassan will give a dance lesson to help you warm up before showtime. This will be a memorable night to not miss. See you then! Saturday 15 March 2025 from 20:00-00:00 Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Method Studio - Victoria BC Becky Mowat invited you About Discussion More About Discussion Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Details 48 people responded Event by Becky Mowat and David Lamine Victoria Method Studio - Victoria BC Duration: 4 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Join us in welcoming Mannie for his first time to Victoria! Mannie was born in Zimbabwe and has lived in Manchester, London, San Francisco, NYC and currently in Dallas, Texas. He has a passion for music, dance and performance. He has won both dance and music contests, which is a testament to his technical skill, musicality, and performance artistry. His classes emphasize in precision, fluidity, and personal expression, ensuring that students not only master choreography but also understand the artistry behind it. Whether teaching beginners or advanced dancers, Mannie’s goals are to inspire confidence, discipline, and joy through movement, helping each student discover their unique dance voice. Details We will create two events as they are at separate locations on two different dates. The first one will be held at the Ukrainian Cultural Centre and the second at Medicine Moves Studio. There will be 4 hours of workshops in total. Mannie will be focusing on musicality, expression, connection and communication with your partner. Interested Going Invite Details 12 people responded Event by Victoria Latin Dance Association 111 Superior St, Victoria, BC V8V 1T2, Canada Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Sensual Bachata Series – Monday Nights! Mondays – April 7th, 14th, 21st & 28th at 111 Superior Street Foundation Class (6:30–7:35 PM) Perfect for absolute beginners or dancers looking to strengthen their foundation! In this class, we’ll break down the essential steps, body movement, and partner connection in a fun environment. You’ll learn the basics with proper technique while also adding styling to make your dancing look and feel smooth on the dance floor. No experience or partner needed—just bring your curiosity and energy! Intermediate Class (7:35–8:40 PM) Ready to level up? This class is designed for dancers who already feel comfortable with the basics and want to challenge themselves. We’ll dive into more fun patterns while also exploring musicality—how to connect those movements to the music in a more expressive way. Get ready to build confidence, fluidity, and your own unique style! To Register: Send your e-transfer to maximumotion@gmail.com and include in the memo: Foundation, Intermediate, or Both + Lead or Follow Class Cancellation & Refunds We understand that plans can change. However, due to limited spots, renting space in advance, and the preparation required for each class, we’re unable to offer refunds for cancellations. Please make sure you’re committed before signing up. We truly appreciate your understanding and support! Tuesday 24 June 2025 at 20:30 TD JazzFest 2025: New Jazz Underground Wicket Hall About Discussion More About Discussion TD JazzFest 2025: New Jazz Underground Interested Going Invite Details 1 person responded Event by Victoria Jazz Society Wicket Hall Tickets jazzvictoria.ca/new-jazz-underground Public · Anyone on or off Facebook “It absolutely cooks here.” – NPR American rising star collective New Jazz Underground merges traditional jazz with the modern influence of swing, hip-hop, house/afro-beat, and Afro-Cuban music. Millions of listeners were introduced to their undeniably fresh sound through viral videos, featuring the band’s exuberant chemistry, effortless musicality, and raw ambition. After meeting as students at The Juilliard School, core members Sebastian Rios (bassist/composer) and TJ Reddick (drummer) began playing in the parks of NYC during lock-down in 2020 and frequently collaborating with pianist Emmet Cohen. Releases such as MF Doom Suite, Harlem to Havana, and cook/swing/work/relax demonstrate their reverence towards jazz icons, yet establish their own voice and new sounds that transcend genres. Reddick and Rios have played as sidemen for Jon Batiste, Sullivan Fortner, and ELEW, among many more, and Rios is a long-time student of legendary bassist Ron Carter. NJU’s album Dying of Thirst just released in 2025. Dynamic and powerful performers, New Jazz Underground is re-energizing contemporary music from the inside out, blazing a path for young jazz musicians in the modern music landscape. See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Sunday 11 May 2025 at 19:00 String Theory ay Hermann’s Jazz Club Hermann's Jazz Club About Discussion More About Discussion String Theory ay Hermann’s Jazz Club Details 25 people responded Event by Big Awesome Entertainment and Eric Harper Hermann's Jazz Club Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Victoria BC!! Sunday May 11, come celebrate Mother’s Day with an evening of beautiful music! Two of Canadas foremost guitarists join together for an unparalleled evening of spectacular music. Having achieved impeccable musicianship and craft during his European conservatory training, Eric Harper took on the new challenge of studying film scoring at Berklee School of Music. By the time of his graduation, Eric had found his full stride as composer-singer-songwriter, with a style that evokes a mad but moving medley of The Dave Matthews Band, the Gipsy Kings and music a la Cirque du Soleil. Eric’s live show melds a bravura virtuosity with hilarity and heart-felt storytelling from his times living, learning, and loving deeply in multiple countries and cultures. As anyone who has seen an Eric Harper show can attest, there will be a lot of laughs and tears and dancing. Award winning Latin guitarist Doug Towle combines Salsa, Jazz, Flamenco and Pop to create a truly unique musical experience. Doug Towle is one of Canada’s premier guitarists. He has performed across North America in such prestigious events as Guitar Player Live in San Francisco, the Vancouver International Jazz Festival, The Zihuatenejo Guitar Festival in Mexico, several appearances at the Juan De Fuca Festival and the Harmony Arts Festival among countless other festival and club stages. In 2009 Guitar Player Magazine selected Doug from among thousands of hopefuls as a top ten finalist in their Guitar Superstar Competition, solidifying his reputation as one of the top players not only in Canada but globally. Friday 20 June 2025 from 19:00-22:00 WACK! Another West Coast Swing Social Dance Method Studio - Victoria BC Canice Ma invited you Interested Going About Discussion More About Discussion WACK! Another West Coast Swing Social Dance Invite Details 30 people responded Event by Canice Ma and Wyatt Ritchie Method Studio - Victoria BC Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Guess who's back, it's WACK! (please ignore the fact that it's been 2 years...) The schmucks are back with another spontaneous west coast swing social dance, featuring music by DJs Topknot and Amandance from Vancouver! DETAILS: • Friday, June 20th, 2025 • Method Studio, 841 Fisgard St, Victoria, BC • 7-10 pm: social dancing with 100% west coast swing (sorry, no lesson!) • Admission: $10 • Water and AC on us (and maybe some bonus chocolate) • Please keep in mind that parking is limited at the venue GENERAL SOCIAL DANCE ETIQUETTE: • Consent is cool- don't be creepy. • Shake off any shyness and get out there! Ask people to dance regardless if you’re a lead or follow, dancing for 10 years or started yesterday- it's more fun that way! • No teaching or unsolicited feedback on the dance floor. Good vibes only! • If you would like to partake in a steal dance, try to remain with that group for the whole song. • Bring a water bottle! The studio is known to get warm with more bodies in the space so we want you to stay healthy and hydrated. • Personal hygiene is important! Consider bringing a towel and/or a spare shirt to change into if you sweat easily. Our studio has a bathroom and change rooms available for all to use. • We recommend wearing clothes that are easy to move in, especially pants given the nature of the dance. • Clean, comfortable shoes (ideally dance shoes) on the dance floor only! See less Victoria, British Columbia Method Studio - Victoria BC 833 Fisgard St, Victoria, BC V8W 1R9, Canada Guests See All

Tuesday 20 May 2025 from 16:15-19:00 PDT Madison West Coast Swing @ Dancesport Madison, WI, United States, Wisconsin Tue, 6 May Tue, 13 May Tue, 20 May Tue, 27 May About Discussion More About Discussion Madison West Coast Swing @ Dancesport Interested Going Invite Details 2 people responded Event by Madison West Coast Swing Club Madison, WI, United States, Wisconsin Duration: 2 hr 45 min Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Madison West Coast Swing Club hosts social dances on Tuesday evenings! Dance admission includes a 45-minute drop-in lesson prior to the dance, open to anyone with at least some basic West Coast Swing experience. Following the lesson is a 2-hour social dance! May's lessons will focus on variations to make every dance feel unique. - Location: Dancesport of Madison 6529 Normandy Ln, Madison, WI 53719 - 6:15 PM – 7:00 PM — Drop-in lesson with club instructors – if you’ve learned at least a few of the basics, join us for a short class to learn something new and improve your dance skills. - 7:00 PM – 9:00 PM — Social dancing! We accept cash at the door or credit card on our website. For information about admission prices, membership and paying online, check out our website! https://mwcsc.org/dance-events/weekly-dances/ Make sure you are checked in to dance by 7:45 PM, as check-in will close at that time. Pine St. , Seattle, WA, United States, Washington 98122 Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook West Coast Swing is a smooth, modern swing dance with roots in Lindy Hop. It is danced to almost every kind of music including R&B, Hip Hop, Lyrical, and Blues. It is a partner dance of personal expression for both lead and follow, allowing you to style it funky, jazzy, slinky, or swingin’. Known for its fun rhythm changes and improvisation, this is a great dance to have in your social repertoire. Price: $15 ($5 with a valid student ID for all DJed events) Age Requirement: 21+ (only on 2nd Tuesdays, otherwise All Ages) Beginner Lesson: 9:00pm to 9:30pm Social Dance: 9:30pm to 12:30am Music: DJ Sam Lingane Location: Reverie Ballroom | Grand Ballroom See less Seattle 915 E. Sunday 18 May 2025 from 15:00-19:00 PDT West Coast Swing Dance Party | Swing Invasion Weekly Event American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Road, Alpharetta, GA About Discussion More About Discussion West Coast Swing Dance Party | Swing Invasion Weekly Event Interested Going Invite Details 10 people responded Event by Swing Invasion American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Road, Alpharetta, GA Duration: 4 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook It’s Birthday Sunday! We will have a special birthday dance for all of our May babies at 7:30pm. Feel free to bring treats to help celebrate! Our commitment at Swing Invasion is to help every dancer meet their goals in becoming better dancers...whether your goal is to become a better social dancer or become a competitive dancer.  We appreciate all of the dancers who join us for lessons and social dancing every Sunday night. For the dancers who have tested into Competitive Edge, or dancers that have WSDC competitive points to attend this class, we thank you for your support of Competitive Edge and for supporting the other local WCS professionals who come out to Swing Invasion every week.  Beginning 5/4/25, Swing Invasion will implement a new educational structure to the Competitive Edge Class. This month the focus will be on Blues/Swing where our instructors will teach concepts such as Swung Rhythm, Hitches, Double Resistance, Swivels, Boogie Walks, etc. If you have any questions, please reach out to Thomas Willams and Hailey Toro. 6-6:45pm: Level 1: The Basics of WCS Level 2: Beyond the Basics – Skills to Build Your WCS 6:45-7:30pm: Level 1/2: Technique & More for newer WCS dancers Level 3/4: Contemporary Patterns & Advanced Skill Building NEW EDITION Competitive Edge Lesson* with Reggie Beason 7:30-10pm: WCS Dancing with DJ Rich Kopels Looking to ramp up your dance skills quickly? One-on-one mini coaching sessions are available during the social dance. Competitive Edge instructors offer 15 minute mini's for all levels (price varies per instructor) & Kerri Graham offers discounted 10 minute mini's ($5) for beginners. *Competitive Edge Dancers must have met the following criteria: 1) Attended 3-4 WCS group classes/mo within the past 12-36 months. 2) Attended 3-4 WCS dances/mo within the past 12-36 months. 3) Participated in 6-12 private coaching sessions within the past 12-36 months. Dancers may be asked to demonstrate skill set to come into or remain in the Competitive Edge class. All Lessons include the Dance Dancers who join a 6pm lesson will get a 2nd lesson for FREE at 6:45pm! $12 entry for Levels 1-4 $15 entry for Competitive Edge* $7 entry for Social Dance (no lessons) Cash and Venmo accepted Cash bar available American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Rd, Alpharetta, GA 30009 Follow us to stay in the loop! Instagram https://www.instagram.com/swing_invasion/ Facebook https://www.facebook.com/SwingInvasion YouTube https://youtube.com/@SwingInvasion Website https://www.swinginvasion.com/ Swing Invasion offers West Coast Swing group classes, private lessons & social dances. No prior dance experience required. No partner required. We hope you will join us to learn, move and connect on the dance floor every Sunday night 6-10pm! Bring your friends too. After all, dancing is known to not only improve your physical health, but also keeps your mind sharp and improves social skills, mood, balance, strength and endurance! Who doesn't want to help others live their best life through the joy of dance? Thursday 13 March 2025 from 19:30-23:00 Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Ukrainian Cultural Centre Becky Mowat invited you About Discussion More About Discussion Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Details 50 people responded Event by Becky Mowat and David Lamine Victoria Ukrainian Cultural Centre Duration: 3 hr 30 min Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Join us in welcoming Mannie for his first time to Victoria! Mannie was born in Zimbabwe and has lived in Manchester, London, San Francisco, NYC and currently in Dallas, Texas. He has a passion for music, dance and performance. He has won both dance and music contests, which is a testament to his technical skill, musicality, and performance artistry. His classes emphasize in precision, fluidity, and personal expression, ensuring that students not only master choreography but also understand the artistry behind it. Whether teaching beginners or advanced dancers, Mannie’s goals are to inspire confidence, discipline, and joy through movement, helping each student discover their unique dance voice. Details We will create two events as they are at separate locations on two different dates. The first one will be held at the Ukrainian Cultural Centre and the second at Medicine Moves Studio. There will be 4 hours of workshops in total. Mannie will be focusing on musicality, expression, connection and communication with your partner. See less Barcelona, Spain Parc de la Ciutadella Barcelona, Spain The Parc de la Ciutadella is a park on the northeastern edge of Ciutat Vella, Barcelona, Catalonia. For decades following its creation in the mid-19th century, this park was the city's only green space. The 70acre grounds include the city zoo (once home to the albino gorilla Snowflake, who died in 2004), the Parliament of Catalonia, a small lake, museums, and a large fountain designed by Josep Fontserè (with possible contributions by the young Antoni Gaudí).LocationsCitadelIn 1714, during the War of the Spanish Succession, Barcelona was laid siege for 13 months by the army of Philip V of Spain. The city fell, and in order to maintain control over it, and to prevent the Catalans from rebelling as they had in the previous century, Philip V built the citadel of Barcelona, at that time the largest fortress in Europe.A substantial part of the district it was constructed in (La Ribera) was destroyed to obtain the necessary space, leaving its inhabitants homeless. The fortress was characterized by having five corners, which gave the citadel defensive power, and by a rather wide surrounding margin, serving as location for the army's cannons. It included enough buildings to house 8,000 people.Hundreds of Catalans were forced to work on the construction for three years, while the rest of the city provided financial backing for this and for warfare-related expenses as well, with a new tax named el cadestre. Three decades later a quarter was rebuilt around the fortress named Barceloneta, which is located inside the neighborhood Ciutat Vella. Guests See All

Sunday 25 May 2025 from 08:00-10:00 PDT Lindy Hopcats Practice Boston, MA, United States, Massachusetts Sun, 4 May Sun, 11 May Sun, 25 May About Discussion More About Discussion Lindy Hopcats Practice Interested Going Invite Details 1 person responded Event by Lindy Hopcats Boston, MA, United States, Massachusetts Duration: 2 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Are you ready to Lindy, Hopcats? We offer semi-structured swing and jazz dance practice sessions for dancers at all levels. So, like Louis and Ella… Let’s be friends! Practice Dates: -May 4 -May 11 -May 25 Location: Cambridge Multicultural Arts Center (MAC, near Kendall Square), 41 Second St., East Cambridge, MA 02141 Pricing (5$ min, sliding scale): - $5 Lets us break even to keep renting our practice space - $8 Lets us bring in special guests and local instructors - $15+ Lets us bring you special Hopcats projects and events, and supports financial assistance for others The theme for May is Individuality! Everyone is capable of exhibiting unique and amazing movement, and we have exercises to help explore this. Of course if you would rather work on a different topic, the loose structure of the practice allows for you to nerd-out on whatever you are feeling passionate about. This is a practice session for all levels. Beginners are welcome and partners are not required. Hopcats practice typically has a short optional guided group exercise and free practice time where you can work on whatever you like. Beginner coaches are available for anyone looking to cover fundamentals or are a first time dancer. After the practice, we often head to find coffee, food, boba tea, etc. See you there! (Rounded up to a number ending in zero or 5.) We encourage you to take our courses more than once, to learn more thoroughly, to refresh and fun. Tuesday 24 June 2025 at 20:30 TD JazzFest 2025: New Jazz Underground Wicket Hall About Discussion More About Discussion TD JazzFest 2025: New Jazz Underground Interested Going Invite Details 24 people responded Event by Victoria Jazz Society Wicket Hall Tickets jazzvictoria.ca/new-jazz-underground Public · Anyone on or off Facebook “It absolutely cooks here.” – NPR American rising star collective New Jazz Underground merges traditional jazz with the modern influence of swing, hip-hop, house/afro-beat, and Afro-Cuban music. Millions of listeners were introduced to their undeniably fresh sound through viral videos, featuring the band’s exuberant chemistry, effortless musicality, and raw ambition. After meeting as students at The Juilliard School, core members Sebastian Rios (bassist/composer) and TJ Reddick (drummer) began playing in the parks of NYC during lock-down in 2020 and frequently collaborating with pianist Emmet Cohen. Releases such as MF Doom Suite, Harlem to Havana, and cook/swing/work/relax demonstrate their reverence towards jazz icons, yet establish their own voice and new sounds that transcend genres. Reddick and Rios have played as sidemen for Jon Batiste, Sullivan Fortner, and ELEW, among many more, and Rios is a long-time student of legendary bassist Ron Carter. NJU’s album Dying of Thirst just released in 2025. Dynamic and powerful performers, New Jazz Underground is re-energizing contemporary music from the inside out, blazing a path for young jazz musicians in the modern music landscape. Noah Halpern trumpet, Axel Tosca piano TICKETS On sale Friday, April 11! $42 (service charges may apply) Ages 19+ Available Through: Victoria Jazz Society Office (250-388-4423 | 975A Alston St.) no service charges Royal & McPherson Box Office (250-386-6121 | rmts.bc.ca ) plus service charges See less Music and audio Victoria, British Columbia Tickets Find Tickets Wicket Hall 919 Douglas Street, Victoria, BC, Canada, Victoria The Strathcona Hotel's newest venue; everything from live bands to club nights, you can find it here! Bringing you three jam packed days of roller derby featuring 10 teams from across North America. Don't miss it! TICKETS Tournament Passes (valid for all 3 days) are $30 in advance, $35 at the door. Friday is Toonie night! $2 for a full evening of roller derby. General Admission is $20 in advance per day, $25 at the door. Students and Seniors are $15 in advance per day, $20 at the door. As always, children 10 & under are free! ACCESSIBILITY Archie Browning Arena is fully wheelchair accessible. If you would like to request accessible seating please contact us at eodboutproduction@gmail.com. We are happy to offer a free companion ticket for support workers attending with their client. If cost is a barrier for entry, please email us at eodboutproduction@gmail.com Parking at Archie Browning is available in their back lot on a first come, first serve basis. With multiple facilities within Archie Browning Arena and special events happening on a regular basis you may need extra time on event dates to locate a parking space. Street parking is available in the neighbourhood. Bathrooms are located within the facility during the varying hours of operation. BC Transit has bus 15 which will drop you off out front of Archie Browning Arena. Please see the BC Transit website or you can call Archie Browning Arena for more details at (250) 412-8510 Masks are not required, however you are welcome to rock one if you wish! Please stay home if you are feeling unwell or have recently been exposed to COVID-19. ---------------- The Eves of Destruction are grateful to live, train, and play the sport that we love on the unceded territory of several First Nations, including the Lək̓ʷəŋən People, known today as the Songhees and xʷsepsum (Kosapsum) Nations, and the W̱SÁNEĆ Nations: SȾÁUTW (Tsawout), W̱JOȽEȽP (Tsartlip), W̱SIḴEM (Tseycum), BOḰEĆEN (Pauquachin), and MÁLEXEŁ (Malahat). We recognize the complex histories and the ongoing relationships that these Nations have with this land and as a league we prioritize taking meaningful steps towards reconciliation actions, decolonization, and building relationships in our communities. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Sunday 11 May 2025 at 19:00 String Theory ay Hermann’s Jazz Club Hermann's Jazz Club About Discussion More About Discussion String Theory ay Hermann’s Jazz Club Details 25 people responded Event by Big Awesome Entertainment and Eric Harper Hermann's Jazz Club Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Victoria BC!! Sunday May 11, come celebrate Mother’s Day with an evening of beautiful music! Two of Canadas foremost guitarists join together for an unparalleled evening of spectacular music. Having achieved impeccable musicianship and craft during his European conservatory training, Eric Harper took on the new challenge of studying film scoring at Berklee School of Music. By the time of his graduation, Eric had found his full stride as composer-singer-songwriter, with a style that evokes a mad but moving medley of The Dave Matthews Band, the Gipsy Kings and music a la Cirque du Soleil. Eric’s live show melds a bravura virtuosity with hilarity and heart-felt storytelling from his times living, learning, and loving deeply in multiple countries and cultures. As anyone who has seen an Eric Harper show can attest, there will be a lot of laughs and tears and dancing. Award winning Latin guitarist Doug Towle combines Salsa, Jazz, Flamenco and Pop to create a truly unique musical experience. Doug Towle is one of Canada’s premier guitarists. He has performed across North America in such prestigious events as Guitar Player Live in San Francisco, the Vancouver International Jazz Festival, The Zihuatenejo Guitar Festival in Mexico, several appearances at the Juan De Fuca Festival and the Harmony Arts Festival among countless other festival and club stages. In 2009 Guitar Player Magazine selected Doug from among thousands of hopefuls as a top ten finalist in their Guitar Superstar Competition, solidifying his reputation as one of the top players not only in Canada but globally. See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Tuesday 20 May 2025 from 16:15-19:00 PDT Madison West Coast Swing @ Dancesport Madison, WI, United States, Wisconsin Tue, 6 May Tue, 13 May Tue, 20 May Tue, 27 May About Discussion More About Discussion Madison West Coast Swing @ Dancesport Interested Going Invite Details 2 people responded Event by Madison West Coast Swing Club Madison, WI, United States, Wisconsin Duration: 2 hr 45 min Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Madison West Coast Swing Club hosts social dances on Tuesday evenings! Dance admission includes a 45-minute drop-in lesson prior to the dance, open to anyone with at least some basic West Coast Swing experience. Following the lesson is a 2-hour social dance! May's lessons will focus on variations to make every dance feel unique. - Location: Dancesport of Madison 6529 Normandy Ln, Madison, WI 53719 - 6:15 PM – 7:00 PM — Drop-in lesson with club instructors – if you’ve learned at least a few of the basics, join us for a short class to learn something new and improve your dance skills. - 7:00 PM – 9:00 PM — Social dancing! We accept cash at the door or credit card on our website. For information about admission prices, membership and paying online, check out our website! https://mwcsc.org/dance-events/weekly-dances/ Make sure you are checked in to dance by 7:45 PM, as check-in will close at that time. We plan to have events on most Tuesdays in 2025. If we have to cancel due to hazardous weather or unexpected circumstances, we’ll update our Facebook and mailing list. Sunday 18 May 2025 from 15:00-19:00 PDT West Coast Swing Dance Party | Swing Invasion Weekly Event American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Road, Alpharetta, GA About Discussion More About Discussion West Coast Swing Dance Party | Swing Invasion Weekly Event Interested Going Invite Details 12 people responded Event by Swing Invasion American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Road, Alpharetta, GA Duration: 4 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook It’s Birthday Sunday! We will have a special birthday dance for all of our May babies at 7:30pm. Feel free to bring treats to help celebrate! Our commitment at Swing Invasion is to help every dancer meet their goals in becoming better dancers...whether your goal is to become a better social dancer or become a competitive dancer.  We appreciate all of the dancers who join us for lessons and social dancing every Sunday night. For the dancers who have tested into Competitive Edge, or dancers that have WSDC competitive points to attend this class, we thank you for your support of Competitive Edge and for supporting the other local WCS professionals who come out to Swing Invasion every week.  Beginning 5/4/25, Swing Invasion will implement a new educational structure to the Competitive Edge Class. This month the focus will be on Blues/Swing where our instructors will teach concepts such as Swung Rhythm, Hitches, Double Resistance, Swivels, Boogie Walks, etc. If you have any questions, please reach out to Thomas Willams and Hailey Toro. 6-6:45pm: Level 1: The Basics of WCS Level 2: Beyond the Basics – Skills to Build Your WCS 6:45-7:30pm: Level 1/2: Technique & More for newer WCS dancers Level 3/4: Contemporary Patterns & Advanced Skill Building NEW EDITION Competitive Edge Lesson* with Reggie Beason 7:30-10pm: WCS Dancing with DJ Rich Kopels Looking to ramp up your dance skills quickly? One-on-one mini coaching sessions are available during the social dance. Competitive Edge instructors offer 15 minute mini's for all levels (price varies per instructor) & Kerri Graham offers discounted 10 minute mini's ($5) for beginners. *Competitive Edge Dancers must have met the following criteria: 1) Attended 3-4 WCS group classes/mo within the past 12-36 months. 2) Attended 3-4 WCS dances/mo within the past 12-36 months. 3) Participated in 6-12 private coaching sessions within the past 12-36 months. Dancers may be asked to demonstrate skill set to come into or remain in the Competitive Edge class. All Lessons include the Dance Dancers who join a 6pm lesson will get a 2nd lesson for FREE at 6:45pm! $12 entry for Levels 1-4 $15 entry for Competitive Edge* $7 entry for Social Dance (no lessons) Cash and Venmo accepted Cash bar available American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Rd, Alpharetta, GA 30009 Follow us to stay in the loop! Instagram https://www.instagram.com/swing_invasion/ Facebook https://www.facebook.com/SwingInvasion YouTube https://youtube.com/@SwingInvasion Website https://www.swinginvasion.com/ Swing Invasion offers West Coast Swing group classes, private lessons & social dances. No prior dance experience required. No partner required. We hope you will join us to learn, move and connect on the dance floor every Sunday night 6-10pm! Bring your friends too. After all, dancing is known to not only improve your physical health, but also keeps your mind sharp and improves social skills, mood, balance, strength and endurance! Who doesn't want to help others live their best life through the joy of dance? See less Alpharetta, Georgia American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Road, Alpharetta, GA 201 Wills Rd, Alpharetta, GA 30009-6710, United States Guests See All

Friday 20 June 2025 from 19:00-22:00 WACK! Another West Coast Swing Social Dance Method Studio - Victoria BC Canice Ma invited you Interested Going About Discussion More About Discussion WACK! Another West Coast Swing Social Dance Invite Details 30 people responded Event by Canice Ma and Wyatt Ritchie Method Studio - Victoria BC Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Guess who's back, it's WACK! (please ignore the fact that it's been 2 years...) The schmucks are back with another spontaneous west coast swing social dance, featuring music by DJs Topknot and Amandance from Vancouver! DETAILS: • Friday, June 20th, 2025 • Method Studio, 841 Fisgard St, Victoria, BC • 7-10 pm: social dancing with 100% west coast swing (sorry, no lesson!) • Admission: $10 • Water and AC on us (and maybe some bonus chocolate) • Please keep in mind that parking is limited at the venue GENERAL SOCIAL DANCE ETIQUETTE: • Consent is cool- don't be creepy. • Shake off any shyness and get out there! Ask people to dance regardless if you’re a lead or follow, dancing for 10 years or started yesterday- it's more fun that way! • No teaching or unsolicited feedback on the dance floor. Good vibes only! • If you would like to partake in a steal dance, try to remain with that group for the whole song. • Bring a water bottle! The studio is known to get warm with more bodies in the space so we want you to stay healthy and hydrated. • Personal hygiene is important! Consider bringing a towel and/or a spare shirt to change into if you sweat easily. Our studio has a bathroom and change rooms available for all to use. • We recommend wearing clothes that are easy to move in, especially pants given the nature of the dance. • Clean, comfortable shoes (ideally dance shoes) on the dance floor only! Saturday 15 March 2025 from 20:00-00:00 Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Method Studio - Victoria BC Becky Mowat invited you About Discussion More About Discussion Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Details 48 people responded Event by Becky Mowat and David Lamine Victoria Method Studio - Victoria BC Duration: 4 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Join us in welcoming Mannie for his first time to Victoria! Mannie was born in Zimbabwe and has lived in Manchester, London, San Francisco, NYC and currently in Dallas, Texas. He has a passion for music, dance and performance. He has won both dance and music contests, which is a testament to his technical skill, musicality, and performance artistry. His classes emphasize in precision, fluidity, and personal expression, ensuring that students not only master choreography but also understand the artistry behind it. Whether teaching beginners or advanced dancers, Mannie’s goals are to inspire confidence, discipline, and joy through movement, helping each student discover their unique dance voice. Details We will create two events as they are at separate locations on two different dates. The first one will be held at the Ukrainian Cultural Centre and the second at Medicine Moves Studio. There will be 4 hours of workshops in total. Mannie will be focusing on musicality, expression, connection and communication with your partner. See less Barcelona, Spain Parc de la Ciutadella Barcelona, Spain The Parc de la Ciutadella is a park on the northeastern edge of Ciutat Vella, Barcelona, Catalonia. For decades following its creation in the mid-19th century, this park was the city's only green space. The 70acre grounds include the city zoo (once home to the albino gorilla Snowflake, who died in 2004), the Parliament of Catalonia, a small lake, museums, and a large fountain designed by Josep Fontserè (with possible contributions by the young Antoni Gaudí).LocationsCitadelIn 1714, during the War of the Spanish Succession, Barcelona was laid siege for 13 months by the army of Philip V of Spain. The city fell, and in order to maintain control over it, and to prevent the Catalans from rebelling as they had in the previous century, Philip V built the citadel of Barcelona, at that time the largest fortress in Europe.A substantial part of the district it was constructed in (La Ribera) was destroyed to obtain the necessary space, leaving its inhabitants homeless. The fortress was characterized by having five corners, which gave the citadel defensive power, and by a rather wide surrounding margin, serving as location for the army's cannons. It included enough buildings to house 8,000 people.Hundreds of Catalans were forced to work on the construction for three years, while the rest of the city provided financial backing for this and for warfare-related expenses as well, with a new tax named el cadestre. Three decades later a quarter was rebuilt around the fortress named Barceloneta, which is located inside the neighborhood Ciutat Vella. Guests See All

The 70acre grounds include the city zoo (once home to the albino gorilla Snowflake, who died in 2004), the Parliament of Catalonia, a small lake, museums, and a large fountain designed by Josep Fontserè (with possible contributions by the young Antoni Gaudí).LocationsCitadelIn 1714, during the War of the Spanish Succession, Barcelona was laid siege for 13 months by the army of Philip V of Spain. The city fell, and in order to maintain control over it, and to prevent the Catalans from rebelling as they had in the previous century, Philip V built the citadel of Barcelona, at that time the largest fortress in Europe.A substantial part of the district it was constructed in (La Ribera) was destroyed to obtain the necessary space, leaving its inhabitants homeless. The fortress was characterized by having five corners, which gave the citadel defensive power, and by a rather wide surrounding margin, serving as location for the army's cannons. It included enough buildings to house 8,000 people.Hundreds of Catalans were forced to work on the construction for three years, while the rest of the city provided financial backing for this and for warfare-related expenses as well, with a new tax named el cadestre. Three decades later a quarter was rebuilt around the fortress named Barceloneta, which is located inside the neighborhood Ciutat Vella. Guests See All

Wednesday June 4th, 6-count Lindy Hop, Seven Weeks! Chapel, Trinity St-Paul's Centre About Discussion More About Discussion Lindy Hop Beginner Course Starts Wednesday June 4th, 6-count Lindy Hop, Seven Weeks! Interested Going Invite Details 3 people responded Event by Swing Toronto and Simon Threlkeld Chapel, Trinity St-Paul's Centre Duration: 8 days Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Learn Lindy Hop, the joyful classic Swing Dance done all around the world! Lindy Hop 6-count Beginner Course 8:00pm to 9:25pm Wednesdays June 4, 11, 18, 25, July 2, 9, 16, 2025 Teachers: Hyuna Cho, Philipp Lekmanov, Jinglei Zhang Studio, Trinity-St Paul's Centre Registration Here Soon: https://swingtoronto.com/ Prerequisite: No prior experience or partner needed. Absolute beginners are welcome. We have two types of beginner Lindy Hop courses, one focuses on 6-count Lindy Hop and the other on 8-count Lindy Hop. These are the two main rhythm patterns in Lindy Hop. You can take these courses in either order, or can take them both in the same session. 1/2 price if you have taken our Lindy Beginner 6-count course before, in the same role. (Rounded up to a number ending in zero or 5.) We encourage you to take our courses more than once, to learn more thoroughly, to refresh and fun. And it will never be exactly the same course twice, and especially not with different teachers. Drop-in friendly if you've taken the course before, and for the first class, and if you've taken the previous week's class. Swing Toronto website: https://swingtoronto.com Facebook calendar of all Swing Toronto and Waltz https://www.facebook.com/SwingTorontoPage/events See less See less Dance Guests See All

Sunday 25 May 2025 from 08:00-10:00 PDT Lindy Hopcats Practice Boston, MA, United States, Massachusetts Sun, 4 May Sun, 11 May Sun, 25 May About Discussion More About Discussion Lindy Hopcats Practice Interested Going Invite Details 1 person responded Event by Lindy Hopcats Boston, MA, United States, Massachusetts Duration: 2 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Are you ready to Lindy, Hopcats? We offer semi-structured swing and jazz dance practice sessions for dancers at all levels. So, like Louis and Ella… Let’s be friends! Practice Dates: -May 4 -May 11 -May 25 Location: Cambridge Multicultural Arts Center (MAC, near Kendall Square), 41 Second St., East Cambridge, MA 02141 Pricing (5$ min, sliding scale): - $5 Lets us break even to keep renting our practice space - $8 Lets us bring in special guests and local instructors - $15+ Lets us bring you special Hopcats projects and events, and supports financial assistance for others The theme for May is Individuality! Everyone is capable of exhibiting unique and amazing movement, and we have exercises to help explore this. Of course if you would rather work on a different topic, the loose structure of the practice allows for you to nerd-out on whatever you are feeling passionate about. This is a practice session for all levels. Beginners are welcome and partners are not required. Hopcats practice typically has a short optional guided group exercise and free practice time where you can work on whatever you like. Beginner coaches are available for anyone looking to cover fundamentals or are a first time dancer. After the practice, we often head to find coffee, food, boba tea, etc. See you there! Feel free to contact us through Facebook Messenger or email us at lindyhopcats@gmail.com See less Guests See All

Tuesday 24 June 2025 at 20:30 TD JazzFest 2025: New Jazz Underground Wicket Hall About Discussion More About Discussion TD JazzFest 2025: New Jazz Underground Interested Going Invite Details 25 people responded Event by Victoria Jazz Society Wicket Hall Tickets jazzvictoria.ca/new-jazz-underground Public · Anyone on or off Facebook “It absolutely cooks here.” – NPR American rising star collective New Jazz Underground merges traditional jazz with the modern influence of swing, hip-hop, house/afro-beat, and Afro-Cuban music. Millions of listeners were introduced to their undeniably fresh sound through viral videos, featuring the band’s exuberant chemistry, effortless musicality, and raw ambition. After meeting as students at The Juilliard School, core members Sebastian Rios (bassist/composer) and TJ Reddick (drummer) began playing in the parks of NYC during lock-down in 2020 and frequently collaborating with pianist Emmet Cohen. Releases such as MF Doom Suite, Harlem to Havana, and cook/swing/work/relax demonstrate their reverence towards jazz icons, yet establish their own voice and new sounds that transcend genres. Reddick and Rios have played as sidemen for Jon Batiste, Sullivan Fortner, and ELEW, among many more, and Rios is a long-time student of legendary bassist Ron Carter. NJU’s album Dying of Thirst just released in 2025. Dynamic and powerful performers, New Jazz Underground is re-energizing contemporary music from the inside out, blazing a path for young jazz musicians in the modern music landscape. Noah Halpern trumpet, Axel Tosca piano TICKETS On sale Friday, April 11! $42 (service charges may apply) Ages 19+ Available Through: Victoria Jazz Society Office (250-388-4423 | 975A Alston St.) no service charges Royal & McPherson Box Office (250-386-6121 | rmts.bc.ca ) plus service charges See less Music and audio Victoria, British Columbia Tickets Find Tickets Wicket Hall 919 Douglas Street, Victoria, BC, Canada, Victoria The Strathcona Hotel's newest venue; everything from live bands to club nights, you can find it here! See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria, BC Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Sunday 11 May 2025 at 19:00 String Theory ay Hermann’s Jazz Club Hermann's Jazz Club About Discussion More About Discussion String Theory ay Hermann’s Jazz Club Details 25 people responded Event by Big Awesome Entertainment and Eric Harper Hermann's Jazz Club Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Victoria BC!! Sunday May 11, come celebrate Mother’s Day with an evening of beautiful music! Two of Canadas foremost guitarists join together for an unparalleled evening of spectacular music. Having achieved impeccable musicianship and craft during his European conservatory training, Eric Harper took on the new challenge of studying film scoring at Berklee School of Music. By the time of his graduation, Eric had found his full stride as composer-singer-songwriter, with a style that evokes a mad but moving medley of The Dave Matthews Band, the Gipsy Kings and music a la Cirque du Soleil. Eric’s live show melds a bravura virtuosity with hilarity and heart-felt storytelling from his times living, learning, and loving deeply in multiple countries and cultures. As anyone who has seen an Eric Harper show can attest, there will be a lot of laughs and tears and dancing. Award winning Latin guitarist Doug Towle combines Salsa, Jazz, Flamenco and Pop to create a truly unique musical experience. Doug Towle is one of Canada’s premier guitarists. He has performed across North America in such prestigious events as Guitar Player Live in San Francisco, the Vancouver International Jazz Festival, The Zihuatenejo Guitar Festival in Mexico, several appearances at the Juan De Fuca Festival and the Harmony Arts Festival among countless other festival and club stages. In 2009 Guitar Player Magazine selected Doug from among thousands of hopefuls as a top ten finalist in their Guitar Superstar Competition, solidifying his reputation as one of the top players not only in Canada but globally. It is danced to almost every kind of music including R&B, Hip Hop, Lyrical, and Blues. It is a partner dance of personal expression for both lead and follow, allowing you to style it funky, jazzy, slinky, or swingin’. Known for its fun rhythm changes and improvisation, this is a great dance to have in your social repertoire. Sunday 18 May 2025 from 15:00-19:00 PDT West Coast Swing Dance Party | Swing Invasion Weekly Event American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Road, Alpharetta, GA About Discussion More About Discussion West Coast Swing Dance Party | Swing Invasion Weekly Event Interested Going Invite Details 13 people responded Event by Swing Invasion American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Road, Alpharetta, GA Duration: 4 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook It’s Birthday Sunday! We will have a special birthday dance for all of our May babies at 7:30pm. Feel free to bring treats to help celebrate! Our commitment at Swing Invasion is to help every dancer meet their goals in becoming better dancers...whether your goal is to become a better social dancer or become a competitive dancer.  We appreciate all of the dancers who join us for lessons and social dancing every Sunday night. For the dancers who have tested into Competitive Edge, or dancers that have WSDC competitive points to attend this class, we thank you for your support of Competitive Edge and for supporting the other local WCS professionals who come out to Swing Invasion every week.  Beginning 5/4/25, Swing Invasion will implement a new educational structure to the Competitive Edge Class. This month the focus will be on Blues/Swing where our instructors will teach concepts such as Swung Rhythm, Hitches, Double Resistance, Swivels, Boogie Walks, etc. If you have any questions, please reach out to Thomas Willams and Hailey Toro. 6-6:45pm: Level 1: The Basics of WCS Level 2: Beyond the Basics – Skills to Build Your WCS 6:45-7:30pm: Level 1/2: Technique & More for newer WCS dancers Level 3/4: Contemporary Patterns & Advanced Skill Building NEW EDITION Competitive Edge Lesson* with Reggie Beason 7:30-10pm: WCS Dancing with DJ Rich Kopels Looking to ramp up your dance skills quickly? One-on-one mini coaching sessions are available during the social dance. Competitive Edge instructors offer 15 minute mini's for all levels (price varies per instructor) & Kerri Graham offers discounted 10 minute mini's ($5) for beginners. *Competitive Edge Dancers must have met the following criteria: 1) Attended 3-4 WCS group classes/mo within the past 12-36 months. 2) Attended 3-4 WCS dances/mo within the past 12-36 months. 3) Participated in 6-12 private coaching sessions within the past 12-36 months. Dancers may be asked to demonstrate skill set to come into or remain in the Competitive Edge class. All Lessons include the Dance Dancers who join a 6pm lesson will get a 2nd lesson for FREE at 6:45pm! $12 entry for Levels 1-4 $15 entry for Competitive Edge* $7 entry for Social Dance (no lessons) Cash and Venmo accepted Cash bar available American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Rd, Alpharetta, GA 30009 Follow us to stay in the loop! Instagram https://www.instagram.com/swing_invasion/ Facebook https://www.facebook.com/SwingInvasion YouTube https://youtube.com/@SwingInvasion Website https://www.swinginvasion.com/ Swing Invasion offers West Coast Swing group classes, private lessons & social dances. No prior dance experience required. No partner required. We hope you will join us to learn, move and connect on the dance floor every Sunday night 6-10pm! Bring your friends too. After all, dancing is known to not only improve your physical health, but also keeps your mind sharp and improves social skills, mood, balance, strength and endurance! Who doesn't want to help others live their best life through the joy of dance? See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria, BC Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Friday 20 June 2025 from 19:00-22:00 WACK! Another West Coast Swing Social Dance Method Studio - Victoria BC Canice Ma invited you Interested Going About Discussion More About Discussion WACK! Another West Coast Swing Social Dance Invite Details 31 people responded Event by Canice Ma and Wyatt Ritchie Method Studio - Victoria BC Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Guess who's back, it's WACK! (please ignore the fact that it's been 2 years...) The schmucks are back with another spontaneous west coast swing social dance, featuring music by DJs Topknot and Amandance from Vancouver! DETAILS: • Friday, June 20th, 2025 • Method Studio, 841 Fisgard St, Victoria, BC • 7-10 pm: social dancing with 100% west coast swing (sorry, no lesson!) • Admission: $10 • Water and AC on us (and maybe some bonus chocolate) • Please keep in mind that parking is limited at the venue GENERAL SOCIAL DANCE ETIQUETTE: • Consent is cool- don't be creepy. • Shake off any shyness and get out there! Ask people to dance regardless if you’re a lead or follow, dancing for 10 years or started yesterday- it's more fun that way! • No teaching or unsolicited feedback on the dance floor. Good vibes only! • If you would like to partake in a steal dance, try to remain with that group for the whole song. • Bring a water bottle! The studio is known to get warm with more bodies in the space so we want you to stay healthy and hydrated. • Personal hygiene is important! Consider bringing a towel and/or a spare shirt to change into if you sweat easily. Our studio has a bathroom and change rooms available for all to use. • We recommend wearing clothes that are easy to move in, especially pants given the nature of the dance. • Clean, comfortable shoes (ideally dance shoes) on the dance floor only! See less Barcelona, Spain Parc de la Ciutadella Barcelona, Spain The Parc de la Ciutadella is a park on the northeastern edge of Ciutat Vella, Barcelona, Catalonia. For decades following its creation in the mid-19th century, this park was the city's only green space. The 70acre grounds include the city zoo (once home to the albino gorilla Snowflake, who died in 2004), the Parliament of Catalonia, a small lake, museums, and a large fountain designed by Josep Fontserè (with possible contributions by the young Antoni Gaudí).LocationsCitadelIn 1714, during the War of the Spanish Succession, Barcelona was laid siege for 13 months by the army of Philip V of Spain. The city fell, and in order to maintain control over it, and to prevent the Catalans from rebelling as they had in the previous century, Philip V built the citadel of Barcelona, at that time the largest fortress in Europe.A substantial part of the district it was constructed in (La Ribera) was destroyed to obtain the necessary space, leaving its inhabitants homeless. The fortress was characterized by having five corners, which gave the citadel defensive power, and by a rather wide surrounding margin, serving as location for the army's cannons. It included enough buildings to house 8,000 people.Hundreds of Catalans were forced to work on the construction for three years, while the rest of the city provided financial backing for this and for warfare-related expenses as well, with a new tax named el cadestre. Three decades later a quarter was rebuilt around the fortress named Barceloneta, which is located inside the neighborhood Ciutat Vella. Guests See All

Saturday 15 March 2025 from 20:00-00:00 Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Method Studio - Victoria BC Becky Mowat invited you About Discussion More About Discussion Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Details 48 people responded Event by Becky Mowat and David Lamine Victoria Method Studio - Victoria BC Duration: 4 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Join us in welcoming Mannie for his first time to Victoria! Mannie was born in Zimbabwe and has lived in Manchester, London, San Francisco, NYC and currently in Dallas, Texas. He has a passion for music, dance and performance. He has won both dance and music contests, which is a testament to his technical skill, musicality, and performance artistry. His classes emphasize in precision, fluidity, and personal expression, ensuring that students not only master choreography but also understand the artistry behind it. Whether teaching beginners or advanced dancers, Mannie’s goals are to inspire confidence, discipline, and joy through movement, helping each student discover their unique dance voice. Details We will create two events as they are at separate locations on two different dates. The first one will be held at the Ukrainian Cultural Centre and the second at Medicine Moves Studio. There will be 4 hours of workshops in total. Mannie will be focusing on musicality, expression, connection and communication with your partner. In the fountain area, right side. People from all over the world, come, meet new people, and dance! Encuentro de Afrobeat y Urban Kiz en el parque de la Ciutadella. En la zona de las fuentes. Lateral derecho. Gente de todas las partes del mundo, ven, conoce gente y Baila! See less Barcelona, Spain Parc de la Ciutadella Barcelona, Spain The Parc de la Ciutadella is a park on the northeastern edge of Ciutat Vella, Barcelona, Catalonia. For decades following its creation in the mid-19th century, this park was the city's only green space. The 70acre grounds include the city zoo (once home to the albino gorilla Snowflake, who died in 2004), the Parliament of Catalonia, a small lake, museums, and a large fountain designed by Josep Fontserè (with possible contributions by the young Antoni Gaudí).LocationsCitadelIn 1714, during the War of the Spanish Succession, Barcelona was laid siege for 13 months by the army of Philip V of Spain. The city fell, and in order to maintain control over it, and to prevent the Catalans from rebelling as they had in the previous century, Philip V built the citadel of Barcelona, at that time the largest fortress in Europe.A substantial part of the district it was constructed in (La Ribera) was destroyed to obtain the necessary space, leaving its inhabitants homeless. The fortress was characterized by having five corners, which gave the citadel defensive power, and by a rather wide surrounding margin, serving as location for the army's cannons. It included enough buildings to house 8,000 people.Hundreds of Catalans were forced to work on the construction for three years, while the rest of the city provided financial backing for this and for warfare-related expenses as well, with a new tax named el cadestre. Three decades later a quarter was rebuilt around the fortress named Barceloneta, which is located inside the neighborhood Ciutat Vella. Guests See All
