Thursday 13 March 2025 from 19:30-23:00 Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Ukrainian Cultural Centre Becky Mowat invited you About Discussion More About Discussion Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Details 50 people responded Event by Becky Mowat and David Lamine Victoria Ukrainian Cultural Centre Duration: 3 hr 30 min Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Join us in welcoming Mannie for his first time to Victoria! Mannie was born in Zimbabwe and has lived in Manchester, London, San Francisco, NYC and currently in Dallas, Texas. He has a passion for music, dance and performance. He has won both dance and music contests, which is a testament to his technical skill, musicality, and performance artistry. His classes emphasize in precision, fluidity, and personal expression, ensuring that students not only master choreography but also understand the artistry behind it. Whether teaching beginners or advanced dancers, Mannie’s goals are to inspire confidence, discipline, and joy through movement, helping each student discover their unique dance voice. Details We will create two events as they are at separate locations on two different dates. The first one will be held at the Ukrainian Cultural Centre and the second at Medicine Moves Studio. There will be 4 hours of workshops in total. Mannie will be focusing on musicality, expression, connection and communication with your partner. March 13th Workshop: 7:30pm-9:30pm Social Dancing: 9:30-11:00pm Location: Ukrainian Cultural Centre 3277 Douglas St. Victoria, BC March 15th Workshop: 8:00pm-10:00pm Social Dancing: 10:00pm-12:00am Location: Medicine Moves Studio 841 Fisgard St. Victoria, BC Price: $80 (includes both Thursday & Saturday) Please e transfer to becksmith@hotmail.com See less Victoria, British Columbia Ukrainian Cultural Centre 3277 Douglas St, Saanich, BC V8Z 3K9, Canada Guests See All

Wednesday June 4th, 6-count Lindy Hop, Seven Weeks! Chapel, Trinity St-Paul's Centre About Discussion More About Discussion Lindy Hop Beginner Course Starts Wednesday June 4th, 6-count Lindy Hop, Seven Weeks! Interested Going Invite Details 3 people responded Event by Swing Toronto and Simon Threlkeld Chapel, Trinity St-Paul's Centre Duration: 8 days Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Learn Lindy Hop, the joyful classic Swing Dance done all around the world! Lindy Hop 6-count Beginner Course 8:00pm to 9:25pm Wednesdays June 4, 11, 18, 25, July 2, 9, 16, 2025 Teachers: Hyuna Cho, Philipp Lekmanov, Jinglei Zhang Studio, Trinity-St Paul's Centre Registration Here Soon: https://swingtoronto.com/ Prerequisite: No prior experience or partner needed. Absolute beginners are welcome. We have two types of beginner Lindy Hop courses, one focuses on 6-count Lindy Hop and the other on 8-count Lindy Hop. These are the two main rhythm patterns in Lindy Hop. You can take these courses in either order, or can take them both in the same session. 1/2 price if you have taken our Lindy Beginner 6-count course before, in the same role. (Rounded up to a number ending in zero or 5.) We encourage you to take our courses more than once, to learn more thoroughly, to refresh and fun. And it will never be exactly the same course twice, and especially not with different teachers. Drop-in friendly if you've taken the course before, and for the first class, and if you've taken the previous week's class. Swing Toronto website: https://swingtoronto.com Facebook calendar of all Swing Toronto and Waltz https://www.facebook.com/SwingTorontoPage/events See less See less Dance Guests See All

Sunday 25 May 2025 from 08:00-10:00 PDT Lindy Hopcats Practice Boston, MA, United States, Massachusetts Sun, 4 May Sun, 11 May Sun, 25 May About Discussion More About Discussion Lindy Hopcats Practice Interested Going Invite Details 1 person responded Event by Lindy Hopcats Boston, MA, United States, Massachusetts Duration: 2 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Are you ready to Lindy, Hopcats? We offer semi-structured swing and jazz dance practice sessions for dancers at all levels. So, like Louis and Ella… Let’s be friends! Practice Dates: -May 4 -May 11 -May 25 Location: Cambridge Multicultural Arts Center (MAC, near Kendall Square), 41 Second St., East Cambridge, MA 02141 Pricing (5$ min, sliding scale): - $5 Lets us break even to keep renting our practice space - $8 Lets us bring in special guests and local instructors - $15+ Lets us bring you special Hopcats projects and events, and supports financial assistance for others The theme for May is Individuality! Everyone is capable of exhibiting unique and amazing movement, and we have exercises to help explore this. Of course if you would rather work on a different topic, the loose structure of the practice allows for you to nerd-out on whatever you are feeling passionate about. This is a practice session for all levels. Beginners are welcome and partners are not required. Hopcats practice typically has a short optional guided group exercise and free practice time where you can work on whatever you like. Beginner coaches are available for anyone looking to cover fundamentals or are a first time dancer. After the practice, we often head to find coffee, food, boba tea, etc. See you there! Feel free to contact us through Facebook Messenger or email us at lindyhopcats@gmail.com See less Guests See All

Tuesday 24 June 2025 at 20:30 TD JazzFest 2025: New Jazz Underground Wicket Hall About Discussion More About Discussion TD JazzFest 2025: New Jazz Underground Interested Going Invite Details 26 people responded Event by Victoria Jazz Society Wicket Hall Tickets jazzvictoria.ca/new-jazz-underground Public · Anyone on or off Facebook “It absolutely cooks here.” – NPR American rising star collective New Jazz Underground merges traditional jazz with the modern influence of swing, hip-hop, house/afro-beat, and Afro-Cuban music. Millions of listeners were introduced to their undeniably fresh sound through viral videos, featuring the band’s exuberant chemistry, effortless musicality, and raw ambition. After meeting as students at The Juilliard School, core members Sebastian Rios (bassist/composer) and TJ Reddick (drummer) began playing in the parks of NYC during lock-down in 2020 and frequently collaborating with pianist Emmet Cohen. Releases such as MF Doom Suite, Harlem to Havana, and cook/swing/work/relax demonstrate their reverence towards jazz icons, yet establish their own voice and new sounds that transcend genres. Reddick and Rios have played as sidemen for Jon Batiste, Sullivan Fortner, and ELEW, among many more, and Rios is a long-time student of legendary bassist Ron Carter. NJU’s album Dying of Thirst just released in 2025. Dynamic and powerful performers, New Jazz Underground is re-energizing contemporary music from the inside out, blazing a path for young jazz musicians in the modern music landscape. Noah Halpern trumpet, Axel Tosca piano TICKETS On sale Friday, April 11! $42 (service charges may apply) Ages 19+ Available Through: Victoria Jazz Society Office (250-388-4423 | 975A Alston St.) no service charges Royal & McPherson Box Office (250-386-6121 | rmts.bc.ca ) plus service charges See less Music and audio Victoria, British Columbia Tickets Find Tickets Wicket Hall 919 Douglas Street, Victoria, BC, Canada, Victoria, BC The Strathcona Hotel's newest venue; everything from live bands to club nights, you can find it here! Bringing you three jam packed days of roller derby featuring 10 teams from across North America. Don't miss it! TICKETS Tournament Passes (valid for all 3 days) are $30 in advance, $35 at the door. Friday is Toonie night! $2 for a full evening of roller derby. General Admission is $20 in advance per day, $25 at the door. Students and Seniors are $15 in advance per day, $20 at the door. As always, children 10 & under are free! ACCESSIBILITY Archie Browning Arena is fully wheelchair accessible. If you would like to request accessible seating please contact us at eodboutproduction@gmail.com. We are happy to offer a free companion ticket for support workers attending with their client. If cost is a barrier for entry, please email us at eodboutproduction@gmail.com Parking at Archie Browning is available in their back lot on a first come, first serve basis. With multiple facilities within Archie Browning Arena and special events happening on a regular basis you may need extra time on event dates to locate a parking space. Street parking is available in the neighbourhood. Bathrooms are located within the facility during the varying hours of operation. BC Transit has bus 15 which will drop you off out front of Archie Browning Arena. Please see the BC Transit website or you can call Archie Browning Arena for more details at (250) 412-8510 Masks are not required, however you are welcome to rock one if you wish! Please stay home if you are feeling unwell or have recently been exposed to COVID-19. ---------------- The Eves of Destruction are grateful to live, train, and play the sport that we love on the unceded territory of several First Nations, including the Lək̓ʷəŋən People, known today as the Songhees and xʷsepsum (Kosapsum) Nations, and the W̱SÁNEĆ Nations: SȾÁUTW (Tsawout), W̱JOȽEȽP (Tsartlip), W̱SIḴEM (Tseycum), BOḰEĆEN (Pauquachin), and MÁLEXEŁ (Malahat). We recognize the complex histories and the ongoing relationships that these Nations have with this land and as a league we prioritize taking meaningful steps towards reconciliation actions, decolonization, and building relationships in our communities. See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria, BC Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Sunday 11 May 2025 at 19:00 String Theory ay Hermann’s Jazz Club Hermann's Jazz Club About Discussion More About Discussion String Theory ay Hermann’s Jazz Club Details 25 people responded Event by Big Awesome Entertainment and Eric Harper Hermann's Jazz Club Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Victoria BC!! Sunday May 11, come celebrate Mother’s Day with an evening of beautiful music! Two of Canadas foremost guitarists join together for an unparalleled evening of spectacular music. Having achieved impeccable musicianship and craft during his European conservatory training, Eric Harper took on the new challenge of studying film scoring at Berklee School of Music. By the time of his graduation, Eric had found his full stride as composer-singer-songwriter, with a style that evokes a mad but moving medley of The Dave Matthews Band, the Gipsy Kings and music a la Cirque du Soleil. Eric’s live show melds a bravura virtuosity with hilarity and heart-felt storytelling from his times living, learning, and loving deeply in multiple countries and cultures. As anyone who has seen an Eric Harper show can attest, there will be a lot of laughs and tears and dancing. Award winning Latin guitarist Doug Towle combines Salsa, Jazz, Flamenco and Pop to create a truly unique musical experience. Doug Towle is one of Canada’s premier guitarists. He has performed across North America in such prestigious events as Guitar Player Live in San Francisco, the Vancouver International Jazz Festival, The Zihuatenejo Guitar Festival in Mexico, several appearances at the Juan De Fuca Festival and the Harmony Arts Festival among countless other festival and club stages. In 2009 Guitar Player Magazine selected Doug from among thousands of hopefuls as a top ten finalist in their Guitar Superstar Competition, solidifying his reputation as one of the top players not only in Canada but globally. Pine St. , Seattle, WA, United States, Washington 98122 Duration: 3 hr 30 min Public · Anyone on or off Facebook West Coast Swing is a smooth, modern swing dance with roots in Lindy Hop. It is danced to almost every kind of music including R&B, Hip Hop, Lyrical, and Blues. It is a partner dance of personal expression for both lead and follow, allowing you to style it funky, jazzy, slinky, or swingin’. Known for its fun rhythm changes and improvisation, this is a great dance to have in your social repertoire. Price: $15 ($5 with a valid student ID for all DJed events) Age Requirement: All Ages (21+ only on 2nd Tuesdays) Beginner Lesson: 9:00pm to 9:30pm Social Dance: 9:30pm to 12:30am Music: DJ Katie Schneider (Early) & Za (Late) Location: Reverie Ballroom | Grand Ballroom See less Seattle 915 E. Friday 20 June 2025 from 19:00-22:00 WACK! Another West Coast Swing Social Dance Method Studio - Victoria BC Canice Ma invited you Interested Going About Discussion More About Discussion WACK! Another West Coast Swing Social Dance Invite Details 32 people responded Event by Canice Ma and Wyatt Ritchie Method Studio - Victoria BC Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Guess who's back, it's WACK! (please ignore the fact that it's been 2 years...) The schmucks are back with another spontaneous west coast swing social dance, featuring music by DJs Topknot and Amandance from Vancouver! DETAILS: • Friday, June 20th, 2025 • Method Studio, 841 Fisgard St, Victoria, BC • 7-10 pm: social dancing with 100% west coast swing (sorry, no lesson!) • Admission: $10 • Water and AC on us (and maybe some bonus chocolate) • Please keep in mind that parking is limited at the venue GENERAL SOCIAL DANCE ETIQUETTE: • Consent is cool- don't be creepy. • Shake off any shyness and get out there! Ask people to dance regardless if you’re a lead or follow, dancing for 10 years or started yesterday- it's more fun that way! • No teaching or unsolicited feedback on the dance floor. Good vibes only! • If you would like to partake in a steal dance, try to remain with that group for the whole song. • Bring a water bottle! The studio is known to get warm with more bodies in the space so we want you to stay healthy and hydrated. • Personal hygiene is important! Consider bringing a towel and/or a spare shirt to change into if you sweat easily. Our studio has a bathroom and change rooms available for all to use. • We recommend wearing clothes that are easy to move in, especially pants given the nature of the dance. • Clean, comfortable shoes (ideally dance shoes) on the dance floor only! See less Victoria, British Columbia Method Studio - Victoria BC 833 Fisgard St, Victoria, BC V8W 1R9, Canada Guests See All

Saturday 10 May 2025 from 19:00-23:00 West Coast Swing @ DFD, Langley #3 - 20279 97 Ave, Langley, BC, Canada, British Columbia V1M 4B9 About Discussion More About Discussion West Coast Swing @ DFD, Langley Details 42 people responded Event by Dancing for Dessert Ballroom & Latin Dance Studio #3 - 20279 97 Ave, Langley, BC, Canada, British Columbia V1M 4B9 Duration: 4 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook With Michael and Amy starting of your evening and DJ JAmes setting the music-scape, it's going to a fabulous night! 1st: Workshop with Michael & Amy Level - for those comfortable with WCS foundation steps "Triple Steps; Not Just For Show" How to use triple steps to make your dancing better 7:00 pm, $10 at the door 2nd: Dance with DJ JAmes 8-11 pm, $15 at the door Snacks, complimentary! Michael and Amy Fabulous dancers, inspiring teachers and just wonderful people in general, Michael and Amy have been raising WCS dancers in greater Vancouver for the past 15 years.  Their clear instruction and sincere passion for the dance and helping students get better will have you learning, having fun, feeling inspired and motivated! DJ JAmes Who needs no introduction in these parts and, indeed, around the WCSwing world, is an amazing WCS DJ sought after for WCS events around the globe.  Managing to spin the latest and greatest while catering to the dancers at hand, he has a sixth sense - a magical touch one could say - when it comes to playing music to which you just can't sit still. Coming soon... Save the date and register early for Lan VoBa's Choreolite Workshop on June 14th before the end of the Early Bird pricing on June 8th! DJ JAmes is djing that night! In the fountain area, right side. People from all over the world, come, meet new people, and dance! Encuentro de Afrobeat y Urban Kiz en el parque de la Ciutadella. En la zona de las fuentes. Lateral derecho. Gente de todas las partes del mundo, ven, conoce gente y Baila! See less Barcelona, Spain Parc de la Ciutadella Barcelona, Spain The Parc de la Ciutadella is a park on the northeastern edge of Ciutat Vella, Barcelona, Catalonia. For decades following its creation in the mid-19th century, this park was the city's only green space. The 70acre grounds include the city zoo (once home to the albino gorilla Snowflake, who died in 2004), the Parliament of Catalonia, a small lake, museums, and a large fountain designed by Josep Fontserè (with possible contributions by the young Antoni Gaudí).LocationsCitadelIn 1714, during the War of the Spanish Succession, Barcelona was laid siege for 13 months by the army of Philip V of Spain. The city fell, and in order to maintain control over it, and to prevent the Catalans from rebelling as they had in the previous century, Philip V built the citadel of Barcelona, at that time the largest fortress in Europe.A substantial part of the district it was constructed in (La Ribera) was destroyed to obtain the necessary space, leaving its inhabitants homeless. The fortress was characterized by having five corners, which gave the citadel defensive power, and by a rather wide surrounding margin, serving as location for the army's cannons. It included enough buildings to house 8,000 people.Hundreds of Catalans were forced to work on the construction for three years, while the rest of the city provided financial backing for this and for warfare-related expenses as well, with a new tax named el cadestre. Three decades later a quarter was rebuilt around the fortress named Barceloneta, which is located inside the neighborhood Ciutat Vella. Guests See All

Thursday 13 March 2025 from 19:30-23:00 Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Ukrainian Cultural Centre Becky Mowat invited you About Discussion More About Discussion Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Details 50 people responded Event by Becky Mowat and David Lamine Victoria Ukrainian Cultural Centre Duration: 3 hr 30 min Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Join us in welcoming Mannie for his first time to Victoria! Mannie was born in Zimbabwe and has lived in Manchester, London, San Francisco, NYC and currently in Dallas, Texas. He has a passion for music, dance and performance. He has won both dance and music contests, which is a testament to his technical skill, musicality, and performance artistry. His classes emphasize in precision, fluidity, and personal expression, ensuring that students not only master choreography but also understand the artistry behind it. Whether teaching beginners or advanced dancers, Mannie’s goals are to inspire confidence, discipline, and joy through movement, helping each student discover their unique dance voice. Details We will create two events as they are at separate locations on two different dates. The first one will be held at the Ukrainian Cultural Centre and the second at Medicine Moves Studio. There will be 4 hours of workshops in total. Mannie will be focusing on musicality, expression, connection and communication with your partner. March 13th Workshop: 7:30pm-9:30pm Social Dancing: 9:30-11:00pm Location: Ukrainian Cultural Centre 3277 Douglas St. Victoria, BC March 15th Workshop: 8:00pm-10:00pm Social Dancing: 10:00pm-12:00am Location: Medicine Moves Studio 841 Fisgard St. Victoria, BC Price: $80 (includes both Thursday & Saturday) Please e transfer to becksmith@hotmail.com See less Victoria, British Columbia Ukrainian Cultural Centre 3277 Douglas St, Saanich, BC V8Z 3K9, Canada Guests See All

The city fell, and in order to maintain control over it, and to prevent the Catalans from rebelling as they had in the previous century, Philip V built the citadel of Barcelona, at that time the largest fortress in Europe.A substantial part of the district it was constructed in (La Ribera) was destroyed to obtain the necessary space, leaving its inhabitants homeless. The fortress was characterized by having five corners, which gave the citadel defensive power, and by a rather wide surrounding margin, serving as location for the army's cannons. It included enough buildings to house 8,000 people.Hundreds of Catalans were forced to work on the construction for three years, while the rest of the city provided financial backing for this and for warfare-related expenses as well, with a new tax named el cadestre. Three decades later a quarter was rebuilt around the fortress named Barceloneta, which is located inside the neighborhood Ciutat Vella. Guests See All

See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria, BC Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Interested Going Invite Details 3 people responded Event by Swing Toronto and Simon Threlkeld Chapel, Trinity St-Paul's Centre Duration: 8 days Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Learn Lindy Hop, the joyful classic Swing Dance done all around the world! Lindy Hop 6-count Beginner Course 8:00pm to 9:25pm Wednesdays June 4, 11, 18, 25, July 2, 9, 16, 2025 Teachers: Hyuna Cho, Philipp Lekmanov, Jinglei Zhang Studio, Trinity-St Paul's Centre Registration Here Soon: https://swingtoronto.com/ Prerequisite: No prior experience or partner needed. Absolute beginners are welcome. We have two types of beginner Lindy Hop courses, one focuses on 6-count Lindy Hop and the other on 8-count Lindy Hop. These are the two main rhythm patterns in Lindy Hop. You can take these courses in either order, or can take them both in the same session. 1/2 price if you have taken our Lindy Beginner 6-count course before, in the same role. (Rounded up to a number ending in zero or 5.) We encourage you to take our courses more than once, to learn more thoroughly, to refresh and fun. And it will never be exactly the same course twice, and especially not with different teachers. Drop-in friendly if you've taken the course before, and for the first class, and if you've taken the previous week's class. Tuesday 24 June 2025 at 20:30 TD JazzFest 2025: New Jazz Underground Wicket Hall About Discussion More About Discussion TD JazzFest 2025: New Jazz Underground Interested Going Invite Details 26 people responded Event by Victoria Jazz Society Wicket Hall Tickets jazzvictoria.ca/new-jazz-underground Public · Anyone on or off Facebook “It absolutely cooks here.” – NPR American rising star collective New Jazz Underground merges traditional jazz with the modern influence of swing, hip-hop, house/afro-beat, and Afro-Cuban music. Millions of listeners were introduced to their undeniably fresh sound through viral videos, featuring the band’s exuberant chemistry, effortless musicality, and raw ambition. After meeting as students at The Juilliard School, core members Sebastian Rios (bassist/composer) and TJ Reddick (drummer) began playing in the parks of NYC during lock-down in 2020 and frequently collaborating with pianist Emmet Cohen. Releases such as MF Doom Suite, Harlem to Havana, and cook/swing/work/relax demonstrate their reverence towards jazz icons, yet establish their own voice and new sounds that transcend genres. Reddick and Rios have played as sidemen for Jon Batiste, Sullivan Fortner, and ELEW, among many more, and Rios is a long-time student of legendary bassist Ron Carter. NJU’s album Dying of Thirst just released in 2025. Dynamic and powerful performers, New Jazz Underground is re-energizing contemporary music from the inside out, blazing a path for young jazz musicians in the modern music landscape. Noah Halpern trumpet, Axel Tosca piano TICKETS On sale Friday, April 11! $42 (service charges may apply) Ages 19+ Available Through: Victoria Jazz Society Office (250-388-4423 | 975A Alston St.) no service charges Royal & McPherson Box Office (250-386-6121 | rmts.bc.ca ) plus service charges See less Music and audio Victoria, British Columbia Tickets Find Tickets Wicket Hall 919 Douglas Street, Victoria, BC, Canada, Victoria, BC The Strathcona Hotel's newest venue; everything from live bands to club nights, you can find it here! Sunday 18 May 2025 from 15:00-19:00 PDT West Coast Swing Dance Party | Swing Invasion Weekly Event American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Road, Alpharetta, GA About Discussion More About Discussion West Coast Swing Dance Party | Swing Invasion Weekly Event Interested Going Invite Details 13 people responded Event by Swing Invasion American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Road, Alpharetta, GA Duration: 4 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook It’s Birthday Sunday! We will have a special birthday dance for all of our May babies at 7:30pm. Feel free to bring treats to help celebrate! Our commitment at Swing Invasion is to help every dancer meet their goals in becoming better dancers...whether your goal is to become a better social dancer or become a competitive dancer.  We appreciate all of the dancers who join us for lessons and social dancing every Sunday night. For the dancers who have tested into Competitive Edge, or dancers that have WSDC competitive points to attend this class, we thank you for your support of Competitive Edge and for supporting the other local WCS professionals who come out to Swing Invasion every week.  Beginning 5/4/25, Swing Invasion will implement a new educational structure to the Competitive Edge Class. This month the focus will be on Blues/Swing where our instructors will teach concepts such as Swung Rhythm, Hitches, Double Resistance, Swivels, Boogie Walks, etc. If you have any questions, please reach out to Thomas Willams and Hailey Toro. 6-6:45pm: Level 1: The Basics of WCS Level 2: Beyond the Basics – Skills to Build Your WCS 6:45-7:30pm: Level 1/2: Technique & More for newer WCS dancers Level 3/4: Contemporary Patterns & Advanced Skill Building NEW EDITION Competitive Edge Lesson* with Reggie Beason 7:30-10pm: WCS Dancing with DJ Rich Kopels Looking to ramp up your dance skills quickly? One-on-one mini coaching sessions are available during the social dance. Competitive Edge instructors offer 15 minute mini's for all levels (price varies per instructor) & Kerri Graham offers discounted 10 minute mini's ($5) for beginners. *Competitive Edge Dancers must have met the following criteria: 1) Attended 3-4 WCS group classes/mo within the past 12-36 months. 2) Attended 3-4 WCS dances/mo within the past 12-36 months. 3) Participated in 6-12 private coaching sessions within the past 12-36 months. Dancers may be asked to demonstrate skill set to come into or remain in the Competitive Edge class. All Lessons include the Dance Dancers who join a 6pm lesson will get a 2nd lesson for FREE at 6:45pm! $12 entry for Levels 1-4 $15 entry for Competitive Edge* $7 entry for Social Dance (no lessons) Cash and Venmo accepted Cash bar available American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Rd, Alpharetta, GA 30009 Follow us to stay in the loop! Instagram https://www.instagram.com/swing_invasion/ Facebook https://www.facebook.com/SwingInvasion YouTube https://youtube.com/@SwingInvasion Website https://www.swinginvasion.com/ Swing Invasion offers West Coast Swing group classes, private lessons & social dances. No prior dance experience required. No partner required. We hope you will join us to learn, move and connect on the dance floor every Sunday night 6-10pm! Bring your friends too. After all, dancing is known to not only improve your physical health, but also keeps your mind sharp and improves social skills, mood, balance, strength and endurance! Who doesn't want to help others live their best life through the joy of dance? Bringing you three jam packed days of roller derby featuring 10 teams from across North America. Don't miss it! TICKETS Tournament Passes (valid for all 3 days) are $30 in advance, $35 at the door. Friday is Toonie night! $2 for a full evening of roller derby. General Admission is $20 in advance per day, $25 at the door. Students and Seniors are $15 in advance per day, $20 at the door. As always, children 10 & under are free! ACCESSIBILITY Archie Browning Arena is fully wheelchair accessible. If you would like to request accessible seating please contact us at eodboutproduction@gmail.com. We are happy to offer a free companion ticket for support workers attending with their client. If cost is a barrier for entry, please email us at eodboutproduction@gmail.com Parking at Archie Browning is available in their back lot on a first come, first serve basis. With multiple facilities within Archie Browning Arena and special events happening on a regular basis you may need extra time on event dates to locate a parking space. Street parking is available in the neighbourhood. Bathrooms are located within the facility during the varying hours of operation. BC Transit has bus 15 which will drop you off out front of Archie Browning Arena. Please see the BC Transit website or you can call Archie Browning Arena for more details at (250) 412-8510 Masks are not required, however you are welcome to rock one if you wish! Please stay home if you are feeling unwell or have recently been exposed to COVID-19. ---------------- The Eves of Destruction are grateful to live, train, and play the sport that we love on the unceded territory of several First Nations, including the Lək̓ʷəŋən People, known today as the Songhees and xʷsepsum (Kosapsum) Nations, and the W̱SÁNEĆ Nations: SȾÁUTW (Tsawout), W̱JOȽEȽP (Tsartlip), W̱SIḴEM (Tseycum), BOḰEĆEN (Pauquachin), and MÁLEXEŁ (Malahat). We recognize the complex histories and the ongoing relationships that these Nations have with this land and as a league we prioritize taking meaningful steps towards reconciliation actions, decolonization, and building relationships in our communities. See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria, BC Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Sunday 11 May 2025 at 19:00 String Theory ay Hermann’s Jazz Club Hermann's Jazz Club About Discussion More About Discussion String Theory ay Hermann’s Jazz Club Details 25 people responded Event by Big Awesome Entertainment and Eric Harper Hermann's Jazz Club Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Victoria BC!! Sunday May 11, come celebrate Mother’s Day with an evening of beautiful music! Two of Canadas foremost guitarists join together for an unparalleled evening of spectacular music. Having achieved impeccable musicianship and craft during his European conservatory training, Eric Harper took on the new challenge of studying film scoring at Berklee School of Music. By the time of his graduation, Eric had found his full stride as composer-singer-songwriter, with a style that evokes a mad but moving medley of The Dave Matthews Band, the Gipsy Kings and music a la Cirque du Soleil. Eric’s live show melds a bravura virtuosity with hilarity and heart-felt storytelling from his times living, learning, and loving deeply in multiple countries and cultures. As anyone who has seen an Eric Harper show can attest, there will be a lot of laughs and tears and dancing. Award winning Latin guitarist Doug Towle combines Salsa, Jazz, Flamenco and Pop to create a truly unique musical experience. Doug Towle is one of Canada’s premier guitarists. He has performed across North America in such prestigious events as Guitar Player Live in San Francisco, the Vancouver International Jazz Festival, The Zihuatenejo Guitar Festival in Mexico, several appearances at the Juan De Fuca Festival and the Harmony Arts Festival among countless other festival and club stages. In 2009 Guitar Player Magazine selected Doug from among thousands of hopefuls as a top ten finalist in their Guitar Superstar Competition, solidifying his reputation as one of the top players not only in Canada but globally. Friday 20 June 2025 from 19:00-22:00 WACK! Another West Coast Swing Social Dance Method Studio - Victoria BC Canice Ma invited you Interested Going About Discussion More About Discussion WACK! Another West Coast Swing Social Dance Invite Details 32 people responded Event by Canice Ma and Wyatt Ritchie Method Studio - Victoria BC Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Guess who's back, it's WACK! (please ignore the fact that it's been 2 years...) The schmucks are back with another spontaneous west coast swing social dance, featuring music by DJs Topknot and Amandance from Vancouver! DETAILS: • Friday, June 20th, 2025 • Method Studio, 841 Fisgard St, Victoria, BC • 7-10 pm: social dancing with 100% west coast swing (sorry, no lesson!) • Admission: $10 • Water and AC on us (and maybe some bonus chocolate) • Please keep in mind that parking is limited at the venue GENERAL SOCIAL DANCE ETIQUETTE: • Consent is cool- don't be creepy. • Shake off any shyness and get out there! Ask people to dance regardless if you’re a lead or follow, dancing for 10 years or started yesterday- it's more fun that way! • No teaching or unsolicited feedback on the dance floor. Good vibes only! • If you would like to partake in a steal dance, try to remain with that group for the whole song. • Bring a water bottle! The studio is known to get warm with more bodies in the space so we want you to stay healthy and hydrated. • Personal hygiene is important! Consider bringing a towel and/or a spare shirt to change into if you sweat easily. Our studio has a bathroom and change rooms available for all to use. • We recommend wearing clothes that are easy to move in, especially pants given the nature of the dance. • Clean, comfortable shoes (ideally dance shoes) on the dance floor only! Sunday 25 May 2025 from 15:00-19:00 PDT West Coast Swing Dance Party | Swing Invasion Weekly Event American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Road, Alpharetta, GA About Discussion More About Discussion West Coast Swing Dance Party | Swing Invasion Weekly Event Interested Going Invite Details 5 people responded Event by Swing Invasion American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Road, Alpharetta, GA Duration: 4 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Our commitment at Swing Invasion is to help every dancer meet their goals in becoming better dancers...whether your goal is to become a better social dancer or become a competitive dancer.  We appreciate all of the dancers who join us for lessons and social dancing every Sunday night. For the dancers who have tested into Competitive Edge, or dancers that have WSDC competitive points to attend this class, we thank you for your support of Competitive Edge and for supporting the other local WCS professionals who come out to Swing Invasion every week.  Beginning 5/4/25, Swing Invasion will implement a new educational structure to the Competitive Edge Class. This month the focus will be on Blues/Swing where our instructors will teach concepts such as Swung Rhythm, Hitches, Double Resistance, Swivels, Boogie Walks, etc. If you have any questions, please reach out to Thomas Willams and Hailey Toro. 6-6:45pm: Level 1: The Basics of WCS Level 2: Beyond the Basics – Skills to Build Your WCS 6:45-7:30pm: Level 1/2: Technique & More for newer WCS dancers Level 3/4: Contemporary Patterns & Advanced Skill Building NEW EDITION Competitive Edge Lesson* with Hailey Toro 7:30-10pm: WCS Dancing with DJ Chris Powderly Looking to ramp up your dance skills quickly? One-on-one mini coaching sessions are available during the social dance. Competitive Edge instructors offer 15 minute mini's for all levels (price varies per instructor) & Kerri Graham offers discounted 10 minute mini's ($5) for beginners. *Competitive Edge Dancers must have met the following criteria: 1)  Attended 3-4 WCS group classes/mo within the past 12-36 months. 2)  Attended 3-4 WCS dances/mo within the past 12-36 months. 3)  Participated in 6-12 private coaching sessions within the past 12-36 months. Dancers may be asked to demonstrate skill set to come into or remain in the Competitive Edge class. Pine St. , Seattle, WA, United States, Washington 98122 Duration: 3 hr 30 min Public · Anyone on or off Facebook West Coast Swing is a smooth, modern swing dance with roots in Lindy Hop. It is danced to almost every kind of music including R&B, Hip Hop, Lyrical, and Blues. It is a partner dance of personal expression for both lead and follow, allowing you to style it funky, jazzy, slinky, or swingin’. Known for its fun rhythm changes and improvisation, this is a great dance to have in your social repertoire. Price: $15 ($5 with a valid student ID for all DJed events) Age Requirement: All Ages (21+ only on 2nd Tuesdays) Beginner Lesson: 9:00pm to 9:30pm Social Dance: 9:30pm to 12:30am Music: DJ Rebecca Savoca Location: Reverie Ballroom | Grand Ballroom See less Seattle 915 E. Thursday 13 March 2025 from 19:30-23:00 Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Ukrainian Cultural Centre Becky Mowat invited you About Discussion More About Discussion Urban Kiz Workshop with Mannie Details 50 people responded Event by Becky Mowat and David Lamine Victoria Ukrainian Cultural Centre Duration: 3 hr 30 min Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Join us in welcoming Mannie for his first time to Victoria! Mannie was born in Zimbabwe and has lived in Manchester, London, San Francisco, NYC and currently in Dallas, Texas. He has a passion for music, dance and performance. He has won both dance and music contests, which is a testament to his technical skill, musicality, and performance artistry. His classes emphasize in precision, fluidity, and personal expression, ensuring that students not only master choreography but also understand the artistry behind it. Whether teaching beginners or advanced dancers, Mannie’s goals are to inspire confidence, discipline, and joy through movement, helping each student discover their unique dance voice. Details We will create two events as they are at separate locations on two different dates. The first one will be held at the Ukrainian Cultural Centre and the second at Medicine Moves Studio. There will be 4 hours of workshops in total. Mannie will be focusing on musicality, expression, connection and communication with your partner. See less Barcelona, Spain Parc de la Ciutadella Barcelona, Spain The Parc de la Ciutadella is a park on the northeastern edge of Ciutat Vella, Barcelona, Catalonia. For decades following its creation in the mid-19th century, this park was the city's only green space. The 70acre grounds include the city zoo (once home to the albino gorilla Snowflake, who died in 2004), the Parliament of Catalonia, a small lake, museums, and a large fountain designed by Josep Fontserè (with possible contributions by the young Antoni Gaudí).LocationsCitadelIn 1714, during the War of the Spanish Succession, Barcelona was laid siege for 13 months by the army of Philip V of Spain. The city fell, and in order to maintain control over it, and to prevent the Catalans from rebelling as they had in the previous century, Philip V built the citadel of Barcelona, at that time the largest fortress in Europe.A substantial part of the district it was constructed in (La Ribera) was destroyed to obtain the necessary space, leaving its inhabitants homeless. The fortress was characterized by having five corners, which gave the citadel defensive power, and by a rather wide surrounding margin, serving as location for the army's cannons. It included enough buildings to house 8,000 people.Hundreds of Catalans were forced to work on the construction for three years, while the rest of the city provided financial backing for this and for warfare-related expenses as well, with a new tax named el cadestre. Three decades later a quarter was rebuilt around the fortress named Barceloneta, which is located inside the neighborhood Ciutat Vella. Guests See All

For decades following its creation in the mid-19th century, this park was the city's only green space. The 70acre grounds include the city zoo (once home to the albino gorilla Snowflake, who died in 2004), the Parliament of Catalonia, a small lake, museums, and a large fountain designed by Josep Fontserè (with possible contributions by the young Antoni Gaudí).LocationsCitadelIn 1714, during the War of the Spanish Succession, Barcelona was laid siege for 13 months by the army of Philip V of Spain. The city fell, and in order to maintain control over it, and to prevent the Catalans from rebelling as they had in the previous century, Philip V built the citadel of Barcelona, at that time the largest fortress in Europe.A substantial part of the district it was constructed in (La Ribera) was destroyed to obtain the necessary space, leaving its inhabitants homeless. The fortress was characterized by having five corners, which gave the citadel defensive power, and by a rather wide surrounding margin, serving as location for the army's cannons. It included enough buildings to house 8,000 people.Hundreds of Catalans were forced to work on the construction for three years, while the rest of the city provided financial backing for this and for warfare-related expenses as well, with a new tax named el cadestre. Three decades later a quarter was rebuilt around the fortress named Barceloneta, which is located inside the neighborhood Ciutat Vella. Guests See All

Details 123 people responded Event by BC Swing Dance Club Victoria Centennial Square Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Come join BC Swing Victoria for our second fabulous (and FREE) evening of fun and West Coast Swing dancing at Centennial Square! The schedule for the night will be: 6pm (sharp) there will be an intro lesson to West Coast Swing. 7 - 9pm WCS music will be provided by DJ Carolyn Gebbie. Note: For those who are familiar with the 2019 WCS Rally routine, and would like to practice performing it live prior to Sept 7, the "Hands Up” song will be played at 7:30 and 8:30pm. There will be WCS instructors on hand to answer questions about WCS or how to improve your WCS dancing. Please invite your dance friends by sharing this event! See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria, BC Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Wednesday June 4th, 6-count Lindy Hop, Seven Weeks! Chapel, Trinity St-Paul's Centre About Discussion More About Discussion Lindy Hop Beginner Course Starts Wednesday June 4th, 6-count Lindy Hop, Seven Weeks! Interested Going Invite Details 3 people responded Event by Swing Toronto and Simon Threlkeld Chapel, Trinity St-Paul's Centre Duration: 8 days Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Learn Lindy Hop, the joyful classic Swing Dance done all around the world! Lindy Hop 6-count Beginner Course 8:00pm to 9:25pm Wednesdays June 4, 11, 18, 25, July 2, 9, 16, 2025 Teachers: Hyuna Cho, Philipp Lekmanov, Jinglei Zhang Studio, Trinity-St Paul's Centre Registration Here Soon: https://swingtoronto.com/ Prerequisite: No prior experience or partner needed. Absolute beginners are welcome. We have two types of beginner Lindy Hop courses, one focuses on 6-count Lindy Hop and the other on 8-count Lindy Hop. These are the two main rhythm patterns in Lindy Hop. You can take these courses in either order, or can take them both in the same session. 1/2 price if you have taken our Lindy Beginner 6-count course before, in the same role. (Rounded up to a number ending in zero or 5.) We encourage you to take our courses more than once, to learn more thoroughly, to refresh and fun. And it will never be exactly the same course twice, and especially not with different teachers. Drop-in friendly if you've taken the course before, and for the first class, and if you've taken the previous week's class. Sunday 25 May 2025 from 08:00-10:00 PDT Lindy Hopcats Practice Boston, MA, United States, Massachusetts Sun, 4 May Sun, 11 May Sun, 25 May About Discussion More About Discussion Lindy Hopcats Practice Interested Going Invite Details 1 person responded Event by Lindy Hopcats Boston, MA, United States, Massachusetts Duration: 2 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Are you ready to Lindy, Hopcats? We offer semi-structured swing and jazz dance practice sessions for dancers at all levels. So, like Louis and Ella… Let’s be friends! Practice Dates: -May 4 -May 11 -May 25 Location: Cambridge Multicultural Arts Center (MAC, near Kendall Square), 41 Second St., East Cambridge, MA 02141 Pricing (5$ min, sliding scale): - $5 Lets us break even to keep renting our practice space - $8 Lets us bring in special guests and local instructors - $15+ Lets us bring you special Hopcats projects and events, and supports financial assistance for others The theme for May is Individuality! Everyone is capable of exhibiting unique and amazing movement, and we have exercises to help explore this. Of course if you would rather work on a different topic, the loose structure of the practice allows for you to nerd-out on whatever you are feeling passionate about. This is a practice session for all levels. Beginners are welcome and partners are not required. Hopcats practice typically has a short optional guided group exercise and free practice time where you can work on whatever you like. Beginner coaches are available for anyone looking to cover fundamentals or are a first time dancer. After the practice, we often head to find coffee, food, boba tea, etc. See you there! Feel free to contact us through Facebook Messenger or email us at lindyhopcats@gmail.com See less Guests See All

Tuesday 24 June 2025 at 20:30 TD JazzFest 2025: New Jazz Underground Wicket Hall About Discussion More About Discussion TD JazzFest 2025: New Jazz Underground Interested Going Invite Details 27 people responded Event by Victoria Jazz Society Wicket Hall Tickets jazzvictoria.ca/new-jazz-underground Public · Anyone on or off Facebook “It absolutely cooks here.” – NPR American rising star collective New Jazz Underground merges traditional jazz with the modern influence of swing, hip-hop, house/afro-beat, and Afro-Cuban music. Millions of listeners were introduced to their undeniably fresh sound through viral videos, featuring the band’s exuberant chemistry, effortless musicality, and raw ambition. After meeting as students at The Juilliard School, core members Sebastian Rios (bassist/composer) and TJ Reddick (drummer) began playing in the parks of NYC during lock-down in 2020 and frequently collaborating with pianist Emmet Cohen. Releases such as MF Doom Suite, Harlem to Havana, and cook/swing/work/relax demonstrate their reverence towards jazz icons, yet establish their own voice and new sounds that transcend genres. Reddick and Rios have played as sidemen for Jon Batiste, Sullivan Fortner, and ELEW, among many more, and Rios is a long-time student of legendary bassist Ron Carter. NJU’s album Dying of Thirst just released in 2025. Dynamic and powerful performers, New Jazz Underground is re-energizing contemporary music from the inside out, blazing a path for young jazz musicians in the modern music landscape. Noah Halpern trumpet, Axel Tosca piano TICKETS On sale Friday, April 11! $42 (service charges may apply) Ages 19+ Available Through: Victoria Jazz Society Office (250-388-4423 | 975A Alston St.) no service charges Royal & McPherson Box Office (250-386-6121 | rmts.bc.ca ) plus service charges See less Music and audio Victoria, British Columbia Tickets Find Tickets Wicket Hall 919 Douglas Street, Victoria, BC, Canada, Victoria, BC The Strathcona Hotel's newest venue; everything from live bands to club nights, you can find it here! We will be here July 24-Aug 9th. The Grand American World Trapshooting Championships, annually held in Sparta, IL at the World Shooting & Recreational Complex, is the largest shooting event of its kind. Spanning several days with more than 20 events shooters from all over the globe come to compete in hopes of claiming one of the available prestigious titles such as “Clay Target Champion”. Several of our representatives will be available at this event to help answer your questions. A variety of demo guns will be available to shoot, and a gunsmith will be available for service on a first come first served basis. We will also have apparel and accessories available for purchase. Come see us at our vendor building. Bringing you three jam packed days of roller derby featuring 10 teams from across North America. Don't miss it! TICKETS Tournament Passes (valid for all 3 days) are $30 in advance, $35 at the door. Friday is Toonie night! $2 for a full evening of roller derby. General Admission is $20 in advance per day, $25 at the door. Students and Seniors are $15 in advance per day, $20 at the door. As always, children 10 & under are free! ACCESSIBILITY Archie Browning Arena is fully wheelchair accessible. If you would like to request accessible seating please contact us at eodboutproduction@gmail.com. We are happy to offer a free companion ticket for support workers attending with their client. If cost is a barrier for entry, please email us at eodboutproduction@gmail.com Parking at Archie Browning is available in their back lot on a first come, first serve basis. With multiple facilities within Archie Browning Arena and special events happening on a regular basis you may need extra time on event dates to locate a parking space. Street parking is available in the neighbourhood. Bathrooms are located within the facility during the varying hours of operation. BC Transit has bus 15 which will drop you off out front of Archie Browning Arena. Please see the BC Transit website or you can call Archie Browning Arena for more details at (250) 412-8510 Masks are not required, however you are welcome to rock one if you wish! Please stay home if you are feeling unwell or have recently been exposed to COVID-19. ---------------- The Eves of Destruction are grateful to live, train, and play the sport that we love on the unceded territory of several First Nations, including the Lək̓ʷəŋən People, known today as the Songhees and xʷsepsum (Kosapsum) Nations, and the W̱SÁNEĆ Nations: SȾÁUTW (Tsawout), W̱JOȽEȽP (Tsartlip), W̱SIḴEM (Tseycum), BOḰEĆEN (Pauquachin), and MÁLEXEŁ (Malahat). We recognize the complex histories and the ongoing relationships that these Nations have with this land and as a league we prioritize taking meaningful steps towards reconciliation actions, decolonization, and building relationships in our communities. A few local organizations we encourage you to join us in supporting are: Victoria Native Friendship Centre- https://www.vnfc.ca/ Indigenous Perspective Society- https://ipsociety.ca/ RAVEN: Respecting Aboriginal Values and Environmental Needs- https://raventrust.com See less Victoria, British Columbia Tickets Find Tickets 1151 Esquimalt Rd, Victoria, BC, Canada, British Columbia V9A 3N6 1151 Esquimalt Rd, Esquimalt, BC V9A 3N6, Canada Guests See All 66 Going 82 Interested Go with friends Sue Holloway Invite Mary K. Event Details: Date: Saturday, May 31st, 2025 Time: 3:00-9:00 pm Location: Burnside Gorge Community Association, 471 Cecelia Road Come and experience the vibrant energy of the night, filled with: Multicultural Bazaar Stalls: Discover unique handmade crafts, traditional cultural clothing, jewelry, accessories, and much more! Participants can choose any one of the timed races and complete as many laps as possible within the timeframe. Results will be determined by the distance of your total completed laps. Partial laps will not be counted. Full aid station is provided at start/finish of each lap with water, Hammer Nutrition electrolyte drinks & energy rich "ultra running food". Grass lawn at the start/finish area can be used for personal drop bags / canopies (must be weighted down with weights, no spikes). Direct beach access to cool down during/after race right at the venue. This event is a fundraiser for Wild Sky Community Trails Association ( https://www.wildskytrails.org ), a not-for-profit 501(c)(3) whose mission is to promote and preserve non-motorized trails and recreation access in the Skykomish River Valley. Donations to WSCTA can be made on their website or at the event. Timeline of events on JUN 7, 2025: - 4:30 am: BIB pick-up opens, restrooms open - 5:00 am: start of 12 hrs race - 11:00 am: start of 6 hrs race - 2:00 pm: start of 3 hrs race - 5:00 pm: end of all races, post-race food, awards ceremony Each participant receives a wooden medal/coaster. Registration fees for Lake Tye Challenge are (12/6/3 hrs): 1. Early Bird (until JAN 1, 2025): 65/55/45 2. Regular (until MAY 1, 2025): 75/65/55 3. Late (until JUN 5, 2025): 85/75/65 Registration is here https://ultrasignup.com/register.aspx?did=109581 No day of race registration, no refunds. Race is capped to 100 participants. All proceedings go to Wild Sky Community Trails Association. Directions: From Everett: Route 2, before entering Monroe, turn right to Fryelands Blvd. (0.7 miles to start/parking) From Woodinville: from 522, take Monroe W Main St. exit, stay on W Main St. west bound through two roundabouts, turn right to Fryelands Blvd. (1.0 miles to start/parking) See less Monroe, Washington Lake Tye Park, 14964 Fryelands Blvd, Monroe, WA, United States, Washington 98272 14964 Fryelands Blvd SE, Monroe, WA 98272, United States Guests See All 7 Going 57 Interested Go with friends Sue Holloway Invite Mary K. With a deep appreciation for the craft of DJing, digging, and sharing music, Mood Change (real name Taylor) seeks out classic and contemporary sounds across genres with a focus on the deep, lush and emotive. A longtime contributor to the Canadian west coast scene, Taylor's past efforts have included organizing and promoting local events, curating Versions, a long-running patio party in Calgary and starting the celebrated mix series Excursions.fm. Taylor has been support for acts such as Lone, Leon Vynehall and Mall Grab, and has performed at festivals like Bass Coast, Shambhala, Rifflandia, and Sled Island. The last few years have been a great success and we have raised an amazing amount for the Scottish Huntington's Association. My total raised for the charity is over £47,000!! This year's Charity Ball will take place at The Drouthy Laird, a venue with fantastic food and very reasonable bar prices. A night not to be missed... The Grand American World Trapshooting Championships, annually held in Sparta, IL at the World Shooting & Recreational Complex, is the largest shooting event of its kind. Bringing you three jam packed days of roller derby featuring 10 teams from across North America. Don't miss it! TICKETS Tournament Passes (valid for all 3 days) are $30 in advance, $35 at the door. Friday is Toonie night! $2 for a full evening of roller derby. General Admission is $20 in advance per day, $25 at the door. Students and Seniors are $15 in advance per day, $20 at the door. As always, children 10 & under are free! ACCESSIBILITY Archie Browning Arena is fully wheelchair accessible. If you would like to request accessible seating please contact us at eodboutproduction@gmail.com. We are happy to offer a free companion ticket for support workers attending with their client. If cost is a barrier for entry, please email us at eodboutproduction@gmail.com Parking at Archie Browning is available in their back lot on a first come, first serve basis. With multiple facilities within Archie Browning Arena and special events happening on a regular basis you may need extra time on event dates to locate a parking space. Street parking is available in the neighbourhood. Bathrooms are located within the facility during the varying hours of operation. BC Transit has bus 15 which will drop you off out front of Archie Browning Arena. Please see the BC Transit website or you can call Archie Browning Arena for more details at (250) 412-8510 Masks are not required, however you are welcome to rock one if you wish! Please stay home if you are feeling unwell or have recently been exposed to COVID-19. ---------------- The Eves of Destruction are grateful to live, train, and play the sport that we love on the unceded territory of several First Nations, including the Lək̓ʷəŋən People, known today as the Songhees and xʷsepsum (Kosapsum) Nations, and the W̱SÁNEĆ Nations: SȾÁUTW (Tsawout), W̱JOȽEȽP (Tsartlip), W̱SIḴEM (Tseycum), BOḰEĆEN (Pauquachin), and MÁLEXEŁ (Malahat). We recognize the complex histories and the ongoing relationships that these Nations have with this land and as a league we prioritize taking meaningful steps towards reconciliation actions, decolonization, and building relationships in our communities. A few local organizations we encourage you to join us in supporting are: Victoria Native Friendship Centre- https://www.vnfc.ca/ Indigenous Perspective Society- https://ipsociety.ca/ RAVEN: Respecting Aboriginal Values and Environmental Needs- https://raventrust.com See less Victoria, British Columbia Tickets Find Tickets 1151 Esquimalt Rd, Victoria, BC, Canada, British Columbia V9A 3N6 1151 Esquimalt Rd, Esquimalt, BC V9A 3N6, Canada Guests See All 66 Going 82 Interested Go with friends Sue Holloway Invite Mary K. Participants can choose any one of the timed races and complete as many laps as possible within the timeframe. Results will be determined by the distance of your total completed laps. Partial laps will not be counted. Full aid station is provided at start/finish of each lap with water, Hammer Nutrition electrolyte drinks & energy rich "ultra running food". Grass lawn at the start/finish area can be used for personal drop bags / canopies (must be weighted down with weights, no spikes). Direct beach access to cool down during/after race right at the venue. This event is a fundraiser for Wild Sky Community Trails Association ( https://www.wildskytrails.org ), a not-for-profit 501(c)(3) whose mission is to promote and preserve non-motorized trails and recreation access in the Skykomish River Valley. Donations to WSCTA can be made on their website or at the event. Timeline of events on JUN 7, 2025: - 4:30 am: BIB pick-up opens, restrooms open - 5:00 am: start of 12 hrs race - 11:00 am: start of 6 hrs race - 2:00 pm: start of 3 hrs race - 5:00 pm: end of all races, post-race food, awards ceremony Each participant receives a wooden medal/coaster. Registration fees for Lake Tye Challenge are (12/6/3 hrs): 1. Early Bird (until JAN 1, 2025): 65/55/45 2. Regular (until MAY 1, 2025): 75/65/55 3. Late (until JUN 5, 2025): 85/75/65 Registration is here https://ultrasignup.com/register.aspx?did=109581 No day of race registration, no refunds. Race is capped to 100 participants. All proceedings go to Wild Sky Community Trails Association. With a deep appreciation for the craft of DJing, digging, and sharing music, Mood Change (real name Taylor) seeks out classic and contemporary sounds across genres with a focus on the deep, lush and emotive. A longtime contributor to the Canadian west coast scene, Taylor's past efforts have included organizing and promoting local events, curating Versions, a long-running patio party in Calgary and starting the celebrated mix series Excursions.fm. Taylor has been support for acts such as Lone, Leon Vynehall and Mall Grab, and has performed at festivals like Bass Coast, Shambhala, Rifflandia, and Sled Island. We had over 25 participants last year. We'll start at 6:00 pm with some introduction. Then enter an intuitive dance led by Marie-Christine, owner of Intuitive Dance Victoria. It's a full moon - be ready to be wild and free! This full moon is known as the Flower Moon. 6:45 We'll slow down and participate in a poetic circle with Angelique. She has been leading these sessions for months at Haus of Owl and participants love them! Bring your notebook, pens, painting tools, and music instruments! Creativity at its max. 8:00 We'll close the evening with gentle yin yoga movement led by Nancy, yoga alliance instructor since 2020, and share a few words all together before closing our event. Drink. Explore. Bust out your scrunchies, flannel, and baggy jeans—it’s time to party like it’s 1999! Step back into the ultimate era of neon, mixtapes, and iconic pop culture at this totally rad 90s-themed After Hours event. From throwback tunes to nostalgic games, this night is all about celebrating the decade that gave us Tamagotchis, dial-up internet, and the Macarena. What to Expect - Exclusive After-Hours Access: Enjoy the Human History gallery after hours, just for adults! - Interactive Pop-Up Stations: Dive into a variety of activities and geek out with experts at interactive pop-up stations, thoughtfully designed around 90's night. - Music: Get your groove on with beats provided by DJ Boitano - Food and Drink: Available for purchase from Truffles Catering. - Advance Tickets Only: Tickets must be purchased ahead of time—no sales at the door. Limited Pay-What-You-Can tickets available. Members Perks: Current members receive 10% discount. Not a member? Sign up now to join the fun! After Hours events are 19+. Two pieces of valid ID is required for entry (one piece of photo ID). All bags entering the museum are subject to inspection. Images may be taken at the event and may be used by the Royal BC Museum for promotional purposes. Participants are responsible to maintain a safer space, free from oppression and harm, ensuring the well-being of all attendees. This isn’t just any Airsoft event; it’s an action-packed adventure where you can live out your wildest frontier dreams. Join us for The Gunfight at Hell’s Pass 2, where the stakes are high, and the excitement is even higher! Choose your side—will you uphold the law and fight for justice with the Lawmen, defend your territory as an Outlaw, or reclaim the land as the fierce Tribe? The choice is yours, and every decision will shape the fate of this iconic town. Expect more action, more adventure, and an enhanced LARPing experience that will have you feeling like you’ve stepped right into a classic Western film. With intense firefights, strategic gameplay, and immersive storytelling, this event promises to be unforgettable. Mark your calendars and gather your friends for a weekend of camaraderie, competition, and chaos! Don’t miss out on the chance to be part of this epic showdown. Interested Going Invite Details 2 people responded Event by The First Step Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Exciting News! We are thrilled to announce a special event happening on 18 July 2025! On this meaningful day, we will be donating desks and chairs to an under-resourced school in Hammanskraal and officially adopting the school as part of our long-term commitment to empowering education. Even more exciting, we will be launching our very first "The First Step" Branch at the school — a milestone in our mission to create sustainable impact in local communities. Join us as we count down to this incredible day! Stay tuned for updates, and be part of a journey that starts with a single step — but leads to lasting change. Interested Going Invite Details 83 people responded Event by Shannon Moreno Dance Victoria Duration: 4 days Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Victoria Contact Improvisation Festival 2025 Flow with us this summer at VCIF2025—a heartfelt gathering to celebrate and explore the art of Contact Improvisation! When: July 3-6, 2025 A transformative 4-day journey Where: Dance Victoria, 2750 Quadra St. Victoria, BC, Canada Investment: $400/person for the full workshop series ** Early Bird Special: $325/person if you register by May 31, 2025 (limited spots!) Dive into the magic of movement and connection through immersive classes, workshops, and jams led by world-renowned facilitators Chris Aiken, Angie Hauser, Olivia Shaffer, Manuel Rochette, Farley Johansson, and Shannon Moreno. This festival is a vibrant celebration of inclusion, honoring people of all identities, backgrounds, and experiences. Together, we’ll co-create a welcoming, respectful space rooted in kindness, mindfulness, and acceptance—a place where creative spirits thrive! Explore the beauty of dynamic flow, weight-sharing, and intuitive expression. Connect with kindred souls, deepen your practice, and expand your horizons—all in the stunning surroundings of Victoria, BC. Let's move, groove, and create community in the spirit of joy, freedom, and transformation! For more details and registration: http://victoriacontactimprov.com/.../victoria-contact... Centennial Square Carolyn Gebbie invited you About Discussion More About Discussion Free EVENT - West Coast Swing in the Square - August 29! Details 109 people responded Event by BC Swing Dance Club Victoria Centennial Square Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Come join BC Swing Victoria for a fabulous (and FREE) evening of fun and West Coast Swing dancing at Centennial Square! The schedule for the night will be: 6pm (sharp) there will be an intro lesson to West Coast Swing. 7 - 9pm WCS music will be provided by DJ Carolyn Gebbie. Note: For those who are familiar with the 2019 WCS Rally routine, and would like to practice performing it live prior to Sept 7, the "Hands Up” song will be played at 7:30 and 8:30pm. There will be WCS instructors on hand to answer questions about WCS or how to improve your WCS dancing. Please invite your dance friends by sharing this event! See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria, BC Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Join us for an inspiring day dedicated to empowering women who are ready to grow, lead, and thrive in their careers. On May 22nd, BCG will host a full-day Women’s Event in Stockholm—designed for university students across Sweden. You’ll get the chance to: Connect with our senior women leaders and hear their career journeys. Participate in a hands-on workshop. Network with like-minded peers over breakfast and lunch. This event is for ambitious students eager to explore opportunities, learn, and take their next step with confidence. Whether you're just starting to think about your future or are already planning your path, this day is for you. Apply by May 4th to secure your spot: https://careers.bcg.com/.../68079b910b293500bc8.../Women-BCG We look forward to meeting you! In the Lummi language, fire is called "che'kos". In 2025, Čha•k’os Fire Pit is in a pop-up tent with a BBQ pit at this location for summer and fall season, with a smaller menu at certain event times. Our unique menu is made with skli' (love) and care that will have you craving for more! Čha•k’os Fire Pit is excited to see you this year! Seafood made for #seafoodies Event: NW Tune-Up Website: nwtuneup.com Where: The Portal Bellingham Container Village, 298 W Laurel St, Bellingham, WA 98225 Dates: 7/11-7-13/25 Open: 11am - 7pm Time: All Day "A community-forward festival in Bellingham, Washington, fueled by mountain biking, music, art and craft beer. Inspired by elements from the world’s best festivals, immerse yourself in Pacific Northwest culture and experience a vibrant weekend that nurtures community enrichment and connection." Čha•k’os Fire Pit BBQ MENU*: - BBQ Traditional Cooked King Salmon - BBQ Traditional Cooked Sockeye Salmon - BBQ Halibut - Geoduck Clam Chowder (Gluten-Free) - Cooked Dungeness Crab - Cooked Prawns - Native Fried Bread - Sides (optional): Baked Beans and Fresh Potato Salad - Drinks: Pop, Water and Red Bull Online Menu (Prices and Pre-Order): bbqmenu.lummiseafoodmarket.com Pre-orders are appreciated, so we can gage the amount of traffic. Cash, credit/debit, and online payments are excepted. Stay tuned on our social media pages for more events, menu offerings and other up and coming announcements. Alpine Club members get an exclusive discounted $13 day pass for climbing at Crag X Indoor Climbing Centre on Wednesday, May 21, 2025! https://accvi.ca/.../join-us-for-alpine-club-night-at.../ Crag X is an excellent facility with a variety of opportunities for climbers of all levels. Date: Wednesday, May 21, 2025 Time: ACC Club time slot starts at 6:30 PM Location: Crag X Indoor Climbing Centre, 769 Pandora Ave, Victoria Important Details: Rental Costs: Not included in the $13 entry fee – $3 for harness and $6 for shoes, or bring your own Membership & ID: ACC membership card required, along with ID for waiver verification. Waivers: Can be signed online or in person. Belay Requirements: Participants must pass a top rope belay test using our Grigris or be signed in 1:1 by someone who has. Lead Climbing: If lead climbing, participants must pass a lead test using a Grigri. Don’t miss out on this fantastic opportunity to climb with fellow Alpine Club members at a special rate! Mark your calendar and get ready for an exciting night on the wall. No registration needed. We look forward to seeing you there! Rent a table and join us at the MEC Gear Swap to sell your gear. Date: May 10, 2025 Time: 10am - 2pm Table rentals are just $20 (+ fees). All proceeds from table rentals will go to the local Alpine Club of Canada Section What your table rental gets you: - A space to sell your gear at the MEC Gear Swap - A 6ft table and chair - Access to a community of outdoor enthusiasts How it works: - Rent a table through the link - Ensure your gear is clearly priced before you arrive - Upon arrival, check in with an MEC staffer to get your table ready (30min before event start) - Hang out at your table and sell (or swap) your outdoor gear Note: you are responsible for selling your own gear and must be present at your table for the duration of the event. Come prepared with the necessary change (if accepting cash) or an alternative payment method (i.e. square reader or e-transfer) About the MEC Gear Swap Buy, sell or donate your gently used outdoor gear. Our Gear Swap is back, where you can give pre-loved items a new life of adventures. That’s a win for you, the next generation and the planet. Join us at your local MEC store to find deals on previously loved gear or sell your own lightly used gear to give it a second life. Victoria, BC, Canada, British Columbia About Discussion More About Discussion After-work Macaulay Point bike n climb - INAUGURAL S2S EVENT!! Details 6 people responded Event by Seats2Saddles Victoria, BC, Canada, British Columbia Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook WHERE/WHEN: Janion plaza at 5:30PM, leaving at 5;45 SHARP BRING: - Climbing gear (if you have it) or runners if you don’t. - Sufficient food & water for spending a few hours in the sun. - Appropriate clothes (we will be by the water so windbreaker is recommended). - And last but not least, a bike + helmet + lights! VIBE: Very fun and low-stakes.  All ages .     .     .     .      .      .     .     .     .     .     .     .      .     .     .      .     .     . _.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` `._.` Thirteen years ago, I (Liam) took thirty some odd college students on a cyclo-climbing urban adventure to Macaulay Point.  This trip inaugurated my reign as club president of the UVic Outdoors Club.  I learned a lot during my tenure: how to do more with less, how to ease newbies into the outdoors, how to manage social dynamics and insecurities.  These skills sat more or less dormant for the past decade as I focused on my career.  But now, free of the shackles of corporatism, Scott & I seek to resurface on the scene and show y’all a fun time!  Sustainable, accessible, funtastic urban outdoor rec necessitates a tricky balance; however, we feel the simple formula of cycling out to do something exciting and new fits the formula perfectly. So come join us on our inaugural seats2saddles event.  No climbing experience?  Perfect.  Little cycling experience?  Even perfecter.  There are no strings attached, no hidden snags.  Just come out and have a grand ol time.  And don’t forget to pat yourself on the back: you are leading a new generation, one mindful of cost increases and climate change impacts.  Your children (proverbial or otherwise) will thank you for setting such a sustainable example: dino-fuel and pricey admission tickets are not mandatory prerequisites for having a fun time.  Great work! Sunday May 11, come celebrate Mother’s Day with an evening of beautiful music! Two of Canadas foremost guitarists join together for an unparalleled evening of spectacular music. Having achieved impeccable musicianship and craft during his European conservatory training, Eric Harper took on the new challenge of studying film scoring at Berklee School of Music. By the time of his graduation, Eric had found his full stride as composer-singer-songwriter, with a style that evokes a mad but moving medley of The Dave Matthews Band, the Gipsy Kings and music a la Cirque du Soleil. Eric’s live show melds a bravura virtuosity with hilarity and heart-felt storytelling from his times living, learning, and loving deeply in multiple countries and cultures. As anyone who has seen an Eric Harper show can attest, there will be a lot of laughs and tears and dancing. Award winning Latin guitarist Doug Towle combines Salsa, Jazz, Flamenco and Pop to create a truly unique musical experience. Doug Towle is one of Canada’s premier guitarists. He has performed across North America in such prestigious events as Guitar Player Live in San Francisco, the Vancouver International Jazz Festival, The Zihuatenejo Guitar Festival in Mexico, several appearances at the Juan De Fuca Festival and the Harmony Arts Festival among countless other festival and club stages. In 2009 Guitar Player Magazine selected Doug from among thousands of hopefuls as a top ten finalist in their Guitar Superstar Competition, solidifying his reputation as one of the top players not only in Canada but globally. The first event in April, Pump Couture. A fashion show highlighting people living with diabetes showing their glucose sensors or their insulin pump. Yes, I will be one of the models. The second event, with the support of my wife and some family, I will be cycling the length of Vancouver Island. San Josef Bay to Victoria. I know first hand the challenges of living with diabetes, everyday can be a challenge and no day is ever the same. I hope by sending these kids to camp it will give them a better chance to help controlling this terrible disease. Click here to visit my personal page. https://crm2.diabetes.ca/site/TR?px=7618876&pg=personal... where you can make a secure donation. Welcome to Patch Notes, the improvised show for anyone who’s ever argued about the minutiae of magic systems,  who owns more dice than pairs of clean socks, or thinks all stories would be better with the addition of time-travelling aliens. Is that you? This is your kinda show! Each show, we bring you a rotating cast of nerdy improvisers diving headfirst into sci-fi, fantasy, gaming, comic books, and every fandom in between. Each show will contain two acts, with the second being focused on a special theme or format. For August 2025, let's start with issue #1 With your help, we’ll build a brand-new superhero and their world from the ground up. Who are they? How did they get their powers? What sort of villains will they encounter? Let's all find out together. Light snacks and refreshments will be made available for sale. Finances should never be a barrier to the arts. If you are unable to cover the cost of a ticket, please send us a direct message for alternatives. This show is a no-hate space - there is zero tolerance for racism, homophobia, transphobia, ableism, or hatred and bigotry of any kind. Cool kids only. This event is being held on the territories of the Lekwungen people, also known as the Songhees and Esquimalt Nations. In an effort to work towards decolonization, we encourage you to learn about our local Nations and participate in upcoming public events. Information can be found here: https://www.songheesnation.ca/ https://www.esquimaltnation.ca/ We also encourage you to learn about and support the following organizations: https://vnfc.ca/ https://victoriaorangeshirtday.com/ https://ipsociety.ca/ See less Victoria, British Columbia 734 Aldebury St #203, Victoria, BC V9A 5T4 730 Aldebury St, Esquimalt, BC V9A 5T3, Canada Guests See All 4 Going 14 Interested Go with friends Sue Holloway Invite Mary K.
