Welcome to Patch Notes, the improvised show for anyone who’s ever argued about the minutiae of magic systems,  who owns more dice than pairs of clean socks, or thinks all stories would be better with the addition of time-travelling aliens. Is that you? This is your kinda show! Each show, we bring you a rotating cast of nerdy improvisers diving headfirst into sci-fi, fantasy, gaming, comic books, and every fandom in between. Each show will contain two acts, with the second being focused on a special theme or format. For August 2025, let's start with issue #1 With your help, we’ll build a brand-new superhero and their world from the ground up. Who are they? How did they get their powers? What sort of villains will they encounter? Let's all find out together. Light snacks and refreshments will be made available for sale. Finances should never be a barrier to the arts. If you are unable to cover the cost of a ticket, please send us a direct message for alternatives. This show is a no-hate space - there is zero tolerance for racism, homophobia, transphobia, ableism, or hatred and bigotry of any kind. Cool kids only. This event is being held on the territories of the Lekwungen people, also known as the Songhees and Esquimalt Nations. In an effort to work towards decolonization, we encourage you to learn about our local Nations and participate in upcoming public events. Information can be found here: https://www.songheesnation.ca/ https://www.esquimaltnation.ca/ We also encourage you to learn about and support the following organizations: https://vnfc.ca/ https://victoriaorangeshirtday.com/ https://ipsociety.ca/ See less Victoria, British Columbia 734 Aldebury St #203, Victoria, BC V9A 5T4 730 Aldebury St, Esquimalt, BC V9A 5T3, Canada Guests See All 4 Going 15 Interested Go with friends Sue Holloway Invite Mary K. Dance admission includes a 45-minute drop-in lesson prior to the dance, open to anyone with at least some basic West Coast Swing experience. Following the lesson is a 2-hour social dance! May's lessons will focus on variations to make every dance feel unique. - Location: Dancesport of Madison 6529 Normandy Ln, Madison, WI 53719 - 6:15 PM – 7:00 PM — Drop-in lesson with club instructors – if you’ve learned at least a few of the basics, join us for a short class to learn something new and improve your dance skills. - 7:00 PM – 9:00 PM — Social dancing! We accept cash at the door or credit card on our website. For information about admission prices, membership and paying online, check out our website! https://mwcsc.org/dance-events/weekly-dances/ Make sure you are checked in to dance by 7:45 PM, as check-in will close at that time. We plan to have events on most Tuesdays in 2025. If we have to cancel due to hazardous weather or unexpected circumstances, we’ll update our Facebook and mailing list. For over 25 years, athletes have been making the trek to picturesque Vancouver Island for this incredible west coast race experience.  The course features a calm one-loop lake swim at Elk Lake followed by a ride through the scenic Saanich Peninsula and a 2-loop run on the flat soft lake trails of Elk and Beaver Lakes. The event is famous for its commemorative “hoodie” that the participants proudly sport from year to year. The event also features Try-A-Tri, Olympic, Sprint, Duathlon, Aquabike and Relay categories! Another West Coast Swing Social Dance Method Studio - Victoria BC Canice Ma invited you Interested Going About Discussion More About Discussion WACK! Another West Coast Swing Social Dance Invite Details 32 people responded Event by Canice Ma and Wyatt Ritchie Method Studio - Victoria BC Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Guess who's back, it's WACK! (please ignore the fact that it's been 2 years...) The schmucks are back with another spontaneous west coast swing social dance, featuring music by DJs Topknot and Amandance from Vancouver! DETAILS: • Friday, June 20th, 2025 • Method Studio, 841 Fisgard St, Victoria, BC • 7-10 pm: social dancing with 100% west coast swing (sorry, no lesson!) • Admission: $10 • Water and AC on us (and maybe some bonus chocolate) • Please keep in mind that parking is limited at the venue GENERAL SOCIAL DANCE ETIQUETTE: • Consent is cool- don't be creepy. • Shake off any shyness and get out there! Ask people to dance regardless if you’re a lead or follow, dancing for 10 years or started yesterday- it's more fun that way! • No teaching or unsolicited feedback on the dance floor. Good vibes only! • If you would like to partake in a steal dance, try to remain with that group for the whole song. • Bring a water bottle! The studio is known to get warm with more bodies in the space so we want you to stay healthy and hydrated. • Personal hygiene is important! Consider bringing a towel and/or a spare shirt to change into if you sweat easily. Our studio has a bathroom and change rooms available for all to use. • We recommend wearing clothes that are easy to move in, especially pants given the nature of the dance. • Clean, comfortable shoes (ideally dance shoes) on the dance floor only! We will have a special birthday dance for all of our May babies at 7:30pm. Feel free to bring treats to help celebrate! Our commitment at Swing Invasion is to help every dancer meet their goals in becoming better dancers...whether your goal is to become a better social dancer or become a competitive dancer.  We appreciate all of the dancers who join us for lessons and social dancing every Sunday night. For the dancers who have tested into Competitive Edge, or dancers that have WSDC competitive points to attend this class, we thank you for your support of Competitive Edge and for supporting the other local WCS professionals who come out to Swing Invasion every week.  Beginning 5/4/25, Swing Invasion will implement a new educational structure to the Competitive Edge Class. This month the focus will be on Blues/Swing where our instructors will teach concepts such as Swung Rhythm, Hitches, Double Resistance, Swivels, Boogie Walks, etc. If you have any questions, please reach out to Thomas Willams and Hailey Toro. 6-6:45pm: Level 1: The Basics of WCS Level 2: Beyond the Basics – Skills to Build Your WCS 6:45-7:30pm: Level 1/2: Technique & More for newer WCS dancers Level 3/4: Contemporary Patterns & Advanced Skill Building NEW EDITION Competitive Edge Lesson* with Reggie Beason 7:30-10pm: WCS Dancing with DJ Rich Kopels Looking to ramp up your dance skills quickly? One-on-one mini coaching sessions are available during the social dance. Competitive Edge instructors offer 15 minute mini's for all levels (price varies per instructor) & Kerri Graham offers discounted 10 minute mini's ($5) for beginners. *Competitive Edge Dancers must have met the following criteria: 1) Attended 3-4 WCS group classes/mo within the past 12-36 months. 2) Attended 3-4 WCS dances/mo within the past 12-36 months. 3) Participated in 6-12 private coaching sessions within the past 12-36 months. Dancers may be asked to demonstrate skill set to come into or remain in the Competitive Edge class. All Lessons include the Dance Dancers who join a 6pm lesson will get a 2nd lesson for FREE at 6:45pm! $12 entry for Levels 1-4 $15 entry for Competitive Edge* $7 entry for Social Dance (no lessons) Cash and Venmo accepted Cash bar available American Legion Post 201, 201 Wills Rd, Alpharetta, GA 30009 Follow us to stay in the loop! Instagram https://www.instagram.com/swing_invasion/ Facebook https://www.facebook.com/SwingInvasion YouTube https://youtube.com/@SwingInvasion Website https://www.swinginvasion.com/ Swing Invasion offers West Coast Swing group classes, private lessons & social dances. No prior dance experience required. No partner required. We hope you will join us to learn, move and connect on the dance floor every Sunday night 6-10pm! Bring your friends too. After all, dancing is known to not only improve your physical health, but also keeps your mind sharp and improves social skills, mood, balance, strength and endurance! Who doesn't want to help others live their best life through the joy of dance? Pine St. , Seattle, WA, United States, Washington 98122 Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook West Coast Swing is a smooth, modern swing dance with roots in Lindy Hop. It is danced to almost every kind of music including R&B, Hip Hop, Lyrical, and Blues. It is a partner dance of personal expression for both lead and follow, allowing you to style it funky, jazzy, slinky, or swingin’. Known for its fun rhythm changes and improvisation, this is a great dance to have in your social repertoire. Free for dancers registered in a series of WCS lessons. Door opens at 7:30pm. DJ's in the comments. Beginners are welcome. No partner is required. There will NOT be a beginner lesson, but if you're brand new, let the person at the door know and they'll find someone to teach you the starter steps. Dance shoes or socks on the dance floor only. No street shoes. Bring your own water. No food or drink (except water) in the dance area by request of the hall. If you bring a snack to keep your energy up, please enjoy it in the foyer. Pine St. , Seattle, WA, United States, Washington 98122 About Discussion More About Discussion West Coast Swing Dancing + Drop-In Class (All Ages) Interested Going Invite Details 4 people responded Event by Reverie Ballroom 915 E. Pine St. , Seattle, WA, United States, Washington 98122 Duration: 3 hr 30 min Public · Anyone on or off Facebook West Coast Swing is a smooth, modern swing dance with roots in Lindy Hop. It is danced to almost every kind of music including R&B, Hip Hop, Lyrical, and Blues. It is a partner dance of personal expression for both lead and follow, allowing you to style it funky, jazzy, slinky, or swingin’. Known for its fun rhythm changes and improvisation, this is a great dance to have in your social repertoire. See less Barcelona, Spain Parc de la Ciutadella Barcelona, Spain The Parc de la Ciutadella is a park on the northeastern edge of Ciutat Vella, Barcelona, Catalonia. For decades following its creation in the mid-19th century, this park was the city's only green space. The 70acre grounds include the city zoo (once home to the albino gorilla Snowflake, who died in 2004), the Parliament of Catalonia, a small lake, museums, and a large fountain designed by Josep Fontserè (with possible contributions by the young Antoni Gaudí).LocationsCitadelIn 1714, during the War of the Spanish Succession, Barcelona was laid siege for 13 months by the army of Philip V of Spain. The city fell, and in order to maintain control over it, and to prevent the Catalans from rebelling as they had in the previous century, Philip V built the citadel of Barcelona, at that time the largest fortress in Europe.A substantial part of the district it was constructed in (La Ribera) was destroyed to obtain the necessary space, leaving its inhabitants homeless. The fortress was characterized by having five corners, which gave the citadel defensive power, and by a rather wide surrounding margin, serving as location for the army's cannons. It included enough buildings to house 8,000 people.Hundreds of Catalans were forced to work on the construction for three years, while the rest of the city provided financial backing for this and for warfare-related expenses as well, with a new tax named el cadestre. Three decades later a quarter was rebuilt around the fortress named Barceloneta, which is located inside the neighborhood Ciutat Vella. Mannie was born in Zimbabwe and has lived in Manchester, London, San Francisco, NYC and currently in Dallas, Texas. He has a passion for music, dance and performance. He has won both dance and music contests, which is a testament to his technical skill, musicality, and performance artistry. His classes emphasize in precision, fluidity, and personal expression, ensuring that students not only master choreography but also understand the artistry behind it. Whether teaching beginners or advanced dancers, Mannie’s goals are to inspire confidence, discipline, and joy through movement, helping each student discover their unique dance voice. Details We will create two events as they are at separate locations on two different dates. The first one will be held at the Ukrainian Cultural Centre and the second at Medicine Moves Studio. There will be 4 hours of workshops in total. Mannie will be focusing on musicality, expression, connection and communication with your partner. See less Barcelona, Spain Parc de la Ciutadella Barcelona, Spain The Parc de la Ciutadella is a park on the northeastern edge of Ciutat Vella, Barcelona, Catalonia. For decades following its creation in the mid-19th century, this park was the city's only green space. The 70acre grounds include the city zoo (once home to the albino gorilla Snowflake, who died in 2004), the Parliament of Catalonia, a small lake, museums, and a large fountain designed by Josep Fontserè (with possible contributions by the young Antoni Gaudí).LocationsCitadelIn 1714, during the War of the Spanish Succession, Barcelona was laid siege for 13 months by the army of Philip V of Spain. The city fell, and in order to maintain control over it, and to prevent the Catalans from rebelling as they had in the previous century, Philip V built the citadel of Barcelona, at that time the largest fortress in Europe.A substantial part of the district it was constructed in (La Ribera) was destroyed to obtain the necessary space, leaving its inhabitants homeless. The fortress was characterized by having five corners, which gave the citadel defensive power, and by a rather wide surrounding margin, serving as location for the army's cannons. It included enough buildings to house 8,000 people.Hundreds of Catalans were forced to work on the construction for three years, while the rest of the city provided financial backing for this and for warfare-related expenses as well, with a new tax named el cadestre. Three decades later a quarter was rebuilt around the fortress named Barceloneta, which is located inside the neighborhood Ciutat Vella. It’s your favorite dance pup, Malli, here! I’m wagging with excitement to bring you an UrbanKiz weekend you won’t forget! I’ve invited two of my favorite humans, Pidjay & Pamelita, to teach, vibe, and dance with us in Seattle — and guess what? DJ Mojo will be spinning all weekend to keep our tails wagging on the dance floor! Join us for UrbanKiz Weekender – a full weekend of workshops, socials, and good vibes. Centennial Square Carolyn Gebbie invited you About Discussion More About Discussion Free EVENT - West Coast Swing in the Square - Thurs Sept 5! Details 123 people responded Event by BC Swing Dance Club Victoria Centennial Square Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Come join BC Swing Victoria for our second fabulous (and FREE) evening of fun and West Coast Swing dancing at Centennial Square! The schedule for the night will be: 6pm (sharp) there will be an intro lesson to West Coast Swing. 7 - 9pm WCS music will be provided by DJ Carolyn Gebbie. Note: For those who are familiar with the 2019 WCS Rally routine, and would like to practice performing it live prior to Sept 7, the "Hands Up” song will be played at 7:30 and 8:30pm. There will be WCS instructors on hand to answer questions about WCS or how to improve your WCS dancing. Please invite your dance friends by sharing this event! See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria, BC Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. We offer semi-structured swing and jazz dance practice sessions for dancers at all levels. So, like Louis and Ella… Let’s be friends! Practice Dates: -May 4 -May 11 -May 25 Location: Cambridge Multicultural Arts Center (MAC, near Kendall Square), 41 Second St., East Cambridge, MA 02141 Pricing (5$ min, sliding scale): - $5 Lets us break even to keep renting our practice space - $8 Lets us bring in special guests and local instructors - $15+ Lets us bring you special Hopcats projects and events, and supports financial assistance for others The theme for May is Individuality! Everyone is capable of exhibiting unique and amazing movement, and we have exercises to help explore this. Of course if you would rather work on a different topic, the loose structure of the practice allows for you to nerd-out on whatever you are feeling passionate about. This is a practice session for all levels. Beginners are welcome and partners are not required. Hopcats practice typically has a short optional guided group exercise and free practice time where you can work on whatever you like. Beginner coaches are available for anyone looking to cover fundamentals or are a first time dancer. After the practice, we often head to find coffee, food, boba tea, etc. See you there! Feel free to contact us through Facebook Messenger or email us at lindyhopcats@gmail.com See less Guests See All 1 Going 0 Interested Go with friends Sue Holloway Invite Mary K. Chapel, Trinity St-Paul's Centre About Discussion More About Discussion Lindy Hop Beginner Course Starts Wednesday June 4th, 6-count Lindy Hop, Seven Weeks! Interested Going Invite Details 3 people responded Event by Swing Toronto and Simon Threlkeld Chapel, Trinity St-Paul's Centre Duration: 8 days Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Learn Lindy Hop, the joyful classic Swing Dance done all around the world! Lindy Hop 6-count Beginner Course 8:00pm to 9:25pm Wednesdays June 4, 11, 18, 25, July 2, 9, 16, 2025 Teachers: Hyuna Cho, Philipp Lekmanov, Jinglei Zhang Studio, Trinity-St Paul's Centre Registration Here Soon: https://swingtoronto.com/ Prerequisite: No prior experience or partner needed. Absolute beginners are welcome. We have two types of beginner Lindy Hop courses, one focuses on 6-count Lindy Hop and the other on 8-count Lindy Hop. These are the two main rhythm patterns in Lindy Hop. You can take these courses in either order, or can take them both in the same session. 1/2 price if you have taken our Lindy Beginner 6-count course before, in the same role. (Rounded up to a number ending in zero or 5.) We encourage you to take our courses more than once, to learn more thoroughly, to refresh and fun. And it will never be exactly the same course twice, and especially not with different teachers. Drop-in friendly if you've taken the course before, and for the first class, and if you've taken the previous week's class. Millions of listeners were introduced to their undeniably fresh sound through viral videos, featuring the band’s exuberant chemistry, effortless musicality, and raw ambition. After meeting as students at The Juilliard School, core members Sebastian Rios (bassist/composer) and TJ Reddick (drummer) began playing in the parks of NYC during lock-down in 2020 and frequently collaborating with pianist Emmet Cohen. Releases such as MF Doom Suite, Harlem to Havana, and cook/swing/work/relax demonstrate their reverence towards jazz icons, yet establish their own voice and new sounds that transcend genres. Reddick and Rios have played as sidemen for Jon Batiste, Sullivan Fortner, and ELEW, among many more, and Rios is a long-time student of legendary bassist Ron Carter. NJU’s album Dying of Thirst just released in 2025. Dynamic and powerful performers, New Jazz Underground is re-energizing contemporary music from the inside out, blazing a path for young jazz musicians in the modern music landscape. Noah Halpern trumpet, Axel Tosca piano TICKETS On sale Friday, April 11! $42 (service charges may apply) Ages 19+ Available Through: Victoria Jazz Society Office (250-388-4423 | 975A Alston St.) no service charges Royal & McPherson Box Office (250-386-6121 | rmts.bc.ca ) plus service charges See less Music and audio Victoria, British Columbia Tickets Find Tickets Wicket Hall 919 Douglas Street, Victoria, BC, Canada, Victoria, BC The Strathcona Hotel's newest venue; everything from live bands to club nights, you can find it here! With participants chosen from the choral events throughout the 2025 Sydney Eisteddfod, don’t miss your chance to hear some of the best choirs in Sydney performing in front of leading Australian choral experts. This Double Feature Event showcases finalists from The John Lamble Foundation Australasian Championship for Youth Choirs (19 Years and Under) and the Sydney Eisteddfod Australasian Open Choral Championship. This year's adjudicators are Michelle Leonard OAM (Moorambilla Voices) and Sam Allchurch (Sydney Chamber Choir, Gondwana Voices). The choirs receive cash prizes to support their future, supported by The Federated Music Clubs of Australia, The John Lamble Foundation and The Sydney Symposium Choral Foundation. Participants can choose any one of the timed races and complete as many laps as possible within the timeframe. Results will be determined by the distance of your total completed laps. Partial laps will not be counted. Full aid station is provided at start/finish of each lap with water, Hammer Nutrition electrolyte drinks & energy rich "ultra running food". Grass lawn at the start/finish area can be used for personal drop bags / canopies (must be weighted down with weights, no spikes). Direct beach access to cool down during/after race right at the venue. This event is a fundraiser for Wild Sky Community Trails Association ( https://www.wildskytrails.org ), a not-for-profit 501(c)(3) whose mission is to promote and preserve non-motorized trails and recreation access in the Skykomish River Valley. Donations to WSCTA can be made on their website or at the event. Timeline of events on JUN 7, 2025: - 4:30 am: BIB pick-up opens, restrooms open - 5:00 am: start of 12 hrs race - 11:00 am: start of 6 hrs race - 2:00 pm: start of 3 hrs race - 5:00 pm: end of all races, post-race food, awards ceremony Each participant receives a wooden medal/coaster. Registration fees for Lake Tye Challenge are (12/6/3 hrs): 1. Early Bird (until JAN 1, 2025): 65/55/45 2. Regular (until MAY 1, 2025): 75/65/55 3. Late (until JUN 5, 2025): 85/75/65 Registration is here https://ultrasignup.com/register.aspx?did=109581 No day of race registration, no refunds. Race is capped to 100 participants. All proceedings go to Wild Sky Community Trails Association. Bringing you three jam packed days of roller derby featuring 10 teams from across North America. Don't miss it! TICKETS Tournament Passes (valid for all 3 days) are $30 in advance, $35 at the door. Friday is Toonie night! $2 for a full evening of roller derby. General Admission is $20 in advance per day, $25 at the door. Students and Seniors are $15 in advance per day, $20 at the door. As always, children 10 & under are free! ACCESSIBILITY Archie Browning Arena is fully wheelchair accessible. If you would like to request accessible seating please contact us at eodboutproduction@gmail.com. We are happy to offer a free companion ticket for support workers attending with their client. If cost is a barrier for entry, please email us at eodboutproduction@gmail.com Parking at Archie Browning is available in their back lot on a first come, first serve basis. With multiple facilities within Archie Browning Arena and special events happening on a regular basis you may need extra time on event dates to locate a parking space. Street parking is available in the neighbourhood. Bathrooms are located within the facility during the varying hours of operation. BC Transit has bus 15 which will drop you off out front of Archie Browning Arena. Please see the BC Transit website or you can call Archie Browning Arena for more details at (250) 412-8510 Masks are not required, however you are welcome to rock one if you wish! Please stay home if you are feeling unwell or have recently been exposed to COVID-19. ---------------- The Eves of Destruction are grateful to live, train, and play the sport that we love on the unceded territory of several First Nations, including the Lək̓ʷəŋən People, known today as the Songhees and xʷsepsum (Kosapsum) Nations, and the W̱SÁNEĆ Nations: SȾÁUTW (Tsawout), W̱JOȽEȽP (Tsartlip), W̱SIḴEM (Tseycum), BOḰEĆEN (Pauquachin), and MÁLEXEŁ (Malahat). We recognize the complex histories and the ongoing relationships that these Nations have with this land and as a league we prioritize taking meaningful steps towards reconciliation actions, decolonization, and building relationships in our communities. A few local organizations we encourage you to join us in supporting are: Victoria Native Friendship Centre- https://www.vnfc.ca/ Indigenous Perspective Society- https://ipsociety.ca/ RAVEN: Respecting Aboriginal Values and Environmental Needs- https://raventrust.com See less Victoria, British Columbia Tickets Find Tickets 1151 Esquimalt Rd, Victoria, BC, Canada, British Columbia V9A 3N6 1151 Esquimalt Rd, Esquimalt, BC V9A 3N6, Canada Guests See All 71 Going 96 Interested Go with friends Mary K. With a deep appreciation for the craft of DJing, digging, and sharing music, Mood Change (real name Taylor) seeks out classic and contemporary sounds across genres with a focus on the deep, lush and emotive. A longtime contributor to the Canadian west coast scene, Taylor's past efforts have included organizing and promoting local events, curating Versions, a long-running patio party in Calgary and starting the celebrated mix series Excursions.fm. Taylor has been support for acts such as Lone, Leon Vynehall and Mall Grab, and has performed at festivals like Bass Coast, Shambhala, Rifflandia, and Sled Island. Details 123 people responded Event by BC Swing Dance Club Victoria Centennial Square Duration: 3 hr Public · Anyone on or off Facebook Come join BC Swing Victoria for our second fabulous (and FREE) evening of fun and West Coast Swing dancing at Centennial Square! The schedule for the night will be: 6pm (sharp) there will be an intro lesson to West Coast Swing. 7 - 9pm WCS music will be provided by DJ Carolyn Gebbie. Note: For those who are familiar with the 2019 WCS Rally routine, and would like to practice performing it live prior to Sept 7, the "Hands Up” song will be played at 7:30 and 8:30pm. There will be WCS instructors on hand to answer questions about WCS or how to improve your WCS dancing. Please invite your dance friends by sharing this event! See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave. Note: For those who are familiar with the 2019 WCS Rally routine, and would like to practice performing it live prior to Sept 7, the "Hands Up” song will be played at 7:30 and 8:30pm. There will be WCS instructors on hand to answer questions about WCS or how to improve your WCS dancing. Please invite your dance friends by sharing this event! See less Victoria, British Columbia Centennial Square Victoria Centennial Square is a plaza in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. It was built to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the incorporation of the City of Victoria. The Victoria Police Station, city hall and McPherson Playhouse are adjacent to the square. There is a fountain in the square.In the summer, the city hires musicians to perform every weekday, charging no admission fee. For the British Columbia Day holiday, Centennial Square is one of the venues for the Victoria Electronic Music Festival, where musicians and DJs play for free.In the winter, the Downtown Victoria Business Association has temporarily set up Christmas lights, a Ferris wheel, and an ice skating rink in the square.In 2011, Occupy Victoria protesters camped in the square until a court, at the behest of the city, ordered them to leave.
